story:
CareerCrate by no means professes to have the magic bullet to fix all the challenges that our workforce is facing, but we do have the recipe to engage youth in the career exploration process. Which is a crucial first step. After all, it is not possible for someone to follow a career path they don’t know exists…. 

Did you know that if you were searching for a career you could become an unexploded ordinance technician, a geographic information system (GIS) practitioner, or a urine farmer (seriously!). And that's only the tip of the iceberg!


Our career wiki, CareerCrate, when fully developed, will provide videos of expert insights into jobs ranging from the unknown to traditional careers that everyone has heard of. By leveraging the general public as well as our corporate partners and professional associations to upload videos about all sorts of careers, we will build a wiki with tens of thousands of videos. Using the existing site only as a structural template, we will RE-BRAND and EXPAND

We will draw students onto CareerCrate with crazy humor, contests, and things they find fun.

And once they are there, we will capture and keep their attention with informational career content that will be intriguing and presented in a way that they relate to.


As much as it has already achieved, we believe CareerCrate has the potential to go much, much further! We want to expand our wiki to hold tens of thousands of career videos. We want  to reach out to millions more students than we are currently doing, with much more content, loads of fun, and all sorts of things that will engage them so they keep on coming back for more. Currently, career exploration is seen to be boring. Believing as we do that career exploration can be exciting, our aim is to completely change this perception.

Your contributions will be be used for:

  • Staffing: Engaging the staff needed to run CareerCrate at its full potential

  • Content Development: Produce more of our own movies.

  • And mostly, more Marketing and Advertising:

  1. To increase our visibility in order to achieve more video submissions for the wiki from the public, businesses and professional associations. We want CareerCrate to be bursting at the seams with videos about every career imaginable. 


  2. To raise awareness about our site among people engaged in career exploration, as well as their parents, teachers and guidance counsellors.

Your contributions will also assist us in launching a  to go with our increased capacity.



$10 - your name will appear on our special "donor's page" at CareerCrate.com/donor

$35 - A Mouse pad with your choice of "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Zombie slayer by night!"  or "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Vamp by night!" or "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Bookworm by night!"

 


$50 - A T-Shirt with the nifty CareerCrate logo


$70 - A Stainless steel travel mug with 

 your choice of "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Zombie slayer by night!" or "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Vamp by night!" or "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Bookworm by night!"


$100 -A  Hoodie with the nifty CareerCrate logo


$120 - A 24 oz. aluminium water bottle with   your choice of "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Zombie slayer by night!" or "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Vamp by night!" or "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Bookworm by night!"


$300 - A dedicated page on CareerCrate under the "Career Fair" tab 


$500 - 70 000  impressions on your pre-roll ad campaign. You can make as many $500 contributions as you like to tailor you campaign.


$1200 - CA$1500 credit on any event video or corporate video of over $1800 produced by Crate Media

 



$2000 - CA$2500 credit on any commercial or corporate video of over $5000 produced by Crate Media


$5000 - $7000 credit on video production/s for over $12000 produced by Crate Media


$10 000 - $14 000 credit on video production/s for over $22 000 produced by Crate Media


  • For Students: The most fun career exploration resource. To be used in conjunction with other career guidance tools. Ensures that you are able to make an informed decision about direction you wish to follow after leaving school . This keeps student debt down as there is less chance of direction changes at college or university, and allows you to get into the workforce sooner.

  • For Parents: Ensures that your child doesn't change direction while at college or university, or even drop out AFTER you have invested half of your life savings in their studies. Also ensures that you don’t have to endure your child lazing around the house for a year after finishing school, groaning that they don’t know what to do with their life.

  • For Teachers, Guidance Councellors, Librarians and Career Professionals: A formidable tool to add to your array of career resources.

  • For Professional Associations and Unions: A very focused platform to advocate for the career types that you represent, and to advertise what you can offer members.

  • For Schools, Colleges and Universities: A highly targeted website to promote your institution and highlight courses and programs you offer.

  • For Businesses: A highly targeted website to promote yourself as an employer of choice, detail your company culture and the incentives you offer to employees. To promote those careers where you are currently experiencing or expect to experience workforce shortages. Also to employ people who KNOW what their career path is, thereby increasing workforce retention.

  • For the General Public: Cut down on how much of your hard earned Tax dollars are being wasted on education that is not being completed, and cut down on prices being passed down to you as a consumer from businesses having to re-employ and retrain workers after their predecessors change careers.

  • Spread the word - post the link onto your social media sites

  • Sign up on CareerCrate as member

  • Post a video  about your career. This can be done from your smart phone,  web cam, or even just a slide show with a voice over. Keep it lighthearted. Make us laugh, as long as the video contains all the important details about your job - the experience or education needed, remuneration, hours worked, skill sets, environment. If possible include a related anecdote.

  • Spread the word!

  • Spread the word!!

  • Spread the word!!!

Since our inception a few years ago, despite limited resources, we have:

  • Been listed as a resource on numerous career sites - provincial sites, school boards, universities and colleges across North America and further afield
  • Built up a membership of over 80 000 users
  • Achieve more than 1 000 000 page views some months
  • Achieved a Google ranking of 4
  • Have personally met by chance someone who trained to be a remote head technician after watching a video on our site, and have also been contacted by someone else who found their career on CareerCrate! How many other people are there out there who've found their careers thanks to CareerCrate? 

Imagine how far we can go with the budget that we're after!

It is a big challenge to be sure - but we're stepping up to the plate. Currently the workforce is filled with people who are dissatisfied with their jobs - most will change careers three times or more. Students are dropping out of university or changing course midway through their studies in their droves. People are also studying for degrees in job types that are saturated, while certain sectors are desperately understaffed. The financial ramifications are enormous - Students and parents are incurring huge debt loads, and the general public is being effected as well with substantial amounts of tax dollars being consumed by the consequences of ill informed career decisions.

Businesses don't escape either. A substantial portion of the workforce will change careers a few times during their working life, wasting resources that employers have invested in them. These costs inevitably make their way down to the consumer.

The reasons behind this can be found in the fact that there is universal disinterest in among youth in career guidance. Guidance councilors at schools, colleges and universities  acknowledge that engaging youth in Career Exploration is at best daunting.

CareerCrate's goal is to make our video based career exploration wiki so enticing to students and other career seekers so that not only will they be thrilled to discover CareerCrate, they will keep coming back for more. We will be able to engage them in the first steps of the career exploration process.

 Bernard van Speyk, President and Founder.

Bernard loves a good challenge, and has the tenacity to carry on long after everyone else has packed up and gone home. His wife calls him stubborn. He relishes looking at problems from different angles to find creative solutions. Bernard founded CareerCrate some years ago, and has funded it completely thus far. His belief in it as a very viable solution to a challenging situation is unshakable.

Bernard can be found at his computer for many hours every day, working away at the website, marketing, doing SEO, fixing bugs, promoting Crate Media ,(CareerCrate's media production division), and planning the next step.

When he's not working, Bernard enjoys joking with his sons. Bernard thinks his jokes are great, and they really crack him up. Everyone else thinks his jokes are terrible....

(Want to hear a joke about Sodium Hypobromite? NaBrO.....)

Bernard's background is in the film and video production industry.

Dean Fourie, Vice President Media Production

Dean spends much of his time directing movies all around the world. He is based in Toronto, but spends many hours on airplanes commuting all over to direct mainly commercials. He is known and admired as being a very thorough director with a keen eye for detail.

His awards stretch from D&AD to being a finalist at Cannes and the NY film festival. He is represented by production companies in Europe, USA, Brazil, Turkey, Italy, India, Germany, Czech Republic and Africa.

 As a  child, his dream was to travel the world as a circus performer. He managed to get the travel part right, but he has never found a circus that wanted him....


Baiden McCallum - Our extremely busy campaign co-ordinator

The freshest face on the campaign is Baiden. Currently attending the Queen's School of Business, he marketing and anything to do with the web. Baiden is the bright-eyed student intern at CareerCrate who is assisting with the entire campaign frenzy. 

When he's not promoting the campaign, he likes to spend hours on the web; whether it's updating his dozens of fantasy sports teams, reading small business blogs, or looking at the home decor section of Pinterest, Baiden enjoys it all.

Your contributions will also assist us in launching a  to go with our increased capacity.$10 - your name will appear on our special "donor's page" at CareerCrate.com/donor$35 - A Mouse pad with your choice of "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Zombie slayer by night!"  or "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Vamp by night!" or "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Bookworm by night!" $50 - A T-Shirt with the nifty CareerCrate logo$70 - A Stainless steel travel mug with  your choice of "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Zombie slayer by night!" or "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Vamp by night!" or "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Bookworm by night!"$100 -A  Hoodie with the nifty CareerCrate logo$120 - A 24 oz. aluminium water bottle with   your choice of "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Zombie slayer by night!" or "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Vamp by night!" or "Guidance Counsellor (or HR person, or any other title) by day, Bookworm by night!"$300 - A dedicated page on CareerCrate under the "Career Fair" tab $500 - 70 000  impressions on your pre-roll ad campaign. You can make as many $500 contributions as you like to tailor you campaign.$1200 - CA$1500 credit on any event video or corporate video of over $1800 produced by Crate Media $2000 - CA$2500 credit on any commercial or corporate video of over $5000 produced by Crate Media$5000 - $7000 credit on video production/s for over $12000 produced by Crate Media$10 000 - $14 000 credit on video production/s for over $22 000 produced by Crate Media
For Students: The most fun career exploration resource. To be used in conjunction with other career guidance tools. Ensures that you are able to make an informed decision about direction you wish to follow after leaving school . This keeps student debt down as there is less chance of direction changes at college or university, and allows you to get into the workforce sooner.
For Parents: Ensures that your child doesn't change direction while at college or university, or even drop out AFTER you have invested half of your life savings in their studies. Also ensures that you don’t have to endure your child lazing around the house for a year after finishing school, groaning that they don’t know what to do with their life.
For Teachers, Guidance Councellors, Librarians and Career Professionals: A formidable tool to add to your array of career resources.
For Professional Associations and Unions: A very focused platform to advocate for the career types that you represent, and to advertise what you can offer members.
For Schools, Colleges and Universities: A highly targeted website to promote your institution and highlight courses and programs you offer.
For Businesses: A highly targeted website to promote yourself as an employer of choice, detail your company culture and the incentives you offer to employees. To promote those careers where you are currently experiencing or expect to experience workforce shortages. Also to employ people who KNOW what their career path is, thereby increasing workforce retention.
For the General Public: Cut down on how much of your hard earned Tax dollars are being wasted on education that is not being completed, and cut down on prices being passed down to you as a consumer from businesses having to re-employ and retrain workers after their predecessors change careers.

Spread the word - post the link onto your social media sites
Sign up on CareerCrate as member
Post a video  about your career. This can be done from your smart phone,  web cam, or even just a slide show with a voice over. Keep it lighthearted. Make us laugh, as long as the video contains all the important details about your job - the experience or education needed, remuneration, hours worked, skill sets, environment. If possible include a related anecdote.
Spread the word!
Spread the word!!
Spread the word!!!
Since our inception a few years ago, despite limited resources, we have:
Been listed as a resource on numerous career sites - provincial sites, school boards, universities and colleges across North America and further afield
Built up a membership of over 80 000 users

Achieve more than 1 000 000 page views some months
Achieved a Google ranking of 4
Have personally met by chance someone who trained to be a remote head technician after watching a video on our site, and have also been contacted by someone else who found their career on CareerCrate! How many other people are there out there who've found their careers thanks to CareerCrate? 
Imagine how far we can go with the budget that we're after!It is a big challenge to be sure - but we're stepping up to the plate. Currently the workforce is filled with people who are dissatisfied with their jobs - most will change careers three times or more. Students are dropping out of university or changing course midway through their studies in their droves. People are also studying for degrees in job types that are saturated, while certain sectors are desperately understaffed. The financial ramifications are enormous - Students and parents are incurring huge debt loads, and the general public is being effected as well with substantial amounts of tax dollars being consumed by the consequences of ill informed career decisions.Businesses don't escape either. A substantial portion of the workforce will change careers a few times during their working life, wasting resources that employers have invested in them. These costs inevitably make their way down to the consumer.The reasons behind this can be found in the fact that there is universal disinterest in among youth in career guidance. Guidance councilors at schools, colleges and universities  acknowledge that engaging youth in Career Exploration is at best daunting.CareerCrate's goal is to make our video based career exploration wiki so enticing to students and other career seekers so that not only will they be thrilled to discover CareerCrate, they will keep coming back for more. We will be able to engage them in the first steps of the career exploration process. Bernard van Speyk, President and Founder.Bernard loves a good challenge, and has the tenacity to carry on long after everyone else has packed up and gone home. His wife calls him stubborn. He relishes looking at problems from different angles to find creative solutions. Bernard founded CareerCrate some years ago, and has funded it completely thus far. His belief in it as a very viable solution to a challenging situation is unshakable.Bernard can be found at his computer for many hours every day, working away at the website, marketing, doing SEO, fixing bugs, promoting Crate Media ,(CareerCrate's media production division), and planning the next step.When he's not working, Bernard enjoys joking with his sons. Bernard thinks his jokes are great, and they really crack him up. Everyone else thinks his jokes are terrible....(Want to hear a joke about Sodium Hypobromite? NaBrO.....)Bernard's background is in the film and video production industry.Dean Fourie, Vice President Media ProductionDean spends much of his time directing movies all around the world. He is based in Toronto, but spends many hours on airplanes commuting all over to direct mainly commercials. He is known and admired as being a very thorough director with a keen eye for detail.His awards stretch from D&AD to being a finalist at Cannes and the NY film festival. He is represented by production companies in Europe, USA, Brazil, Turkey, Italy, India, Germany, Czech Republic and Africa. As a  child, his dream was to travel the world as a circus performer. He managed to get the travel part right, but he has never found a circus that wanted him....Baiden McCallum - Our extremely busy campaign co-ordinatorThe freshest face on the campaign is Baiden. Currently attending the Queen's School of Business, he marketing and anything to do with the web. Baiden is the bright-eyed student intern at CareerCrate who is assisting with the entire campaign frenzy. When he's not promoting the campaign, he likes to spend hours on the web; whether it's updating his dozens of fantasy sports teams, reading small business blogs, or looking at the home decor section of Pinterest, Baiden enjoys it all.

story:
Hello!

My name is Annette Navarro, Im 24 yrs old, and Im a singer/songwriter, actress, dancer from Miami, FL. I have been actively performing in my community via street concerts, community theater, student/independent films, and videos. My goal is to start working professionally at what I LOVE to do and to take that step I decided to audition for the highly esteemed summer intensive program: The Performing Arts Project, in which I and 99 other talented contestants from around the world were chosen among thousands for this year! However, I need your help financially to go!

What is the Performing Arts Project?

The Performing Arts Project is a Summer intensive formed by a group of respected educators and entertainment industry professionals to help prepare the next generation of performers in all aspects of the performing arts including acting, dancing and singing. The student body comprises of young performers from around the world who are admitted solely by audition.

Will occur this year at the Wakeforest Univesity campus, NC. Program begins June 30th, 2013.

You can read all about it at: http://www.performingartsproject.com/

How will your contribution help?

Your contribution will cover the program's mandatory tuition which covers:

-Participation in classes and program activities, including private lessons! (Schedule runs Monday-Sunday 9am-10pm, with breaks for lunch and dinner. Think performance training-bootcamp style!)

-Arrival and departure transportation between the Greensboro airport and Wake Forest University(where the program will take place)

-Housing for three weeks at Wake Forest University dorms

-three meals a day, seven days a week.  

Any extra contributions will go towards my flight from Miami to the Greensboro Airport

With your help I'll get to work with industry greats like Jonathan Bernstein (artistic director/playright) and Neil Patrick Stewart (director/writer/producer)!!!!

Thank You!!

No contribution is too small. Thank you for your time, and if you decide you want to contribute to my education this summer, dont forget to check out the perks!

story:
About Me/About BAM

I'm Stacey Rippner. Last spring I started thinking about how I might help kids without many books in their homes build their home libraries. I came up with a free book a month idea which I am calling BAM. BAM stands for Book a Month.

After much consideration I decided to try this program with a group of first graders, to test it out. My hope is to turn this idea into something bigger in the future, involving many more children ages 5-10. Money raised through this Indiegogo campaign will enable all 77 of the first graders at Citizens Academy http://www.citizensacademy.org/campuses/citizen... to receive a new picture book in the mail every month for six months. Citizens Academy is an urban school in Cleveland where I tutor part time. Jen Taylor, Citizens Academy's principal, is excited about this project and so am I.

I have been a teacher for the past twenty years in Chicago, Burlington, Vermont and Cleveland. I've worked in schools and as a private tutor. Last year I shared a hilarious picture book called No David (by David Shannon) with a first grader I was tutoring. He loved the book so much and asked to read it each time we met. I realized it was a book he should own. That thought led me to the idea of starting BAM. 

How Much I Need to Raise 

I need to raise $10,080.00 on Indiegogo to cover the cost of books, mailing supplies, postage and Indiegogo campaign costs. My son (Ruben), my husband (Dan) and my dad (Paul) will be my volunteer BAM helpers. Each month a new title will be selected and mailed to the homes of the Citizens Academy first graders.

Any donation will help. The Indiegogo donation process is easy with a credit card. Please donate and be part of great books entering the homes of first graders in Cleveland, Ohio. 

If the idea of helping kids build their home libraries is not enough to make you want to give, consider this. A twenty year study from The University of Nevada illustrates that children raised in a home with lots of books have more of a chance of academic success later in life, regardless of the family's income. Click on the following link to read about that study http://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2010/05/100520213116.htm . 

Perks

To learn about perks you can receive for donating, watch the following video and read the info. below.


For those of you interested in special perks, I have a few.

$150.00 Donation -- Signed Copy of The Lonely Phone Booth  

  • My talented writer friend Peter Ackerman, donated 20 signed copies of his fun and funny picture book, The Lonely Phone Booth, about one of the last phone booths in NYC. A signed copy can be your for a $150.00 donation. This will be one of the six books students receive.

$75.00 Donation -- Grab a Book Bot (Original Art on a Domino)

  • And... another dear, talented artist friend, Gary Hirsch, who grew up in Cleveland, but now lives in Portland, Oregon, has generously designed and donated his one of a kind domino "Grab a Book" Bots. Bots is short for robots. Contributors of $75.00 will receive one of Gary's original Bots. Each of these small treasures is hand drawn on a domino. These unique pieces of artwork are sold on Etsy, but the “Grab a Book" Bot is brand new, designed with BAM in mind.

$50.00 Donation -- BAM Book/Shopping Bag

  • BAM book/shopping bags will be sent to people who donate $50.00. The fun BAM logo, a robot taking a book out of a mailbox is featured at the top of my Indiegogo page and was also designed by Gary Hirsch.

Don't Want a Perk?

I realize that some of you do not care about receiving a perk. Once you click on the amount you want to donate you will be asked whether you want to change the perk. If you don't want the perk, simply click on “Change the Perk". 

Another Way You Can Help

If you are live in the Cleveland area and are interested in volunteering for BAM, please contact me.

Stacey Rippner  (440) 343-7107  or  stacerip@gmail.com

Thanks so much for taking the time to learn about BAM. With your help I will soon be sending out books to the first graders at Citizens Academy.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Bethany Evans and I am in 7th grade at Evergreen Community Charter School.  I have a once-in-a-lifetime chance to go on a service learning trip with a group of students and teachers from my middle school. I don't usually get a chance to travel ANYWHERE.  This is a huge opportunity for me. I will go and learn about the culture and meet people and do service.  I really want to go because I've always wanted to travel to interesting places.  Ghana, Africa is one of the most interesting places I can think of.

Here is our group's web site and it tells a lot about the trip: www.goingtoghana.org

What We Are Raising

Our whole trip will cost about $4,000 (including airline tickets, lodging, medicine for malaria, and everything else).  My parents and I have already helped raise about 75% of the total through individual and group fundraising (with the other students' families)!  There is still some group fundraising planned, but I need to raise another $750 to be able to go.

(Originally, we thought the group fundraising would be a little higher, but the group had some problems, like having to cancel our biggest fundraiser due to an insurance issue.  But we HAVE raised a lot by having a school dance, raking a lot of leaves all over town, throwing an African Arts night, and getting some nice donations.)

If you can contribute to the $750 I still need, it would be so awesome!  The final payment is due at the end of February and the trip starts on March 23.

The Impact

This is from the Going to Ghana website.  It tells why this trip is so important to me: http://www.goingtoghana.org/bethany.html

Other Ways You Can Help

There are two more fundraisers for the whole group.  Once is a local music concert on February 17 at White Horse Black Mountain, called Malcolm Holcombe and Friends: https://www.facebook.com/events/203925919750291/?fref=ts

The second is that we are raffling off this amazing quilt made by one of the students' grandmothers.  It's even more beautiful in real life.  Tickets are only $5.  http://www.goingtoghana.org/amazing-quilt-raffle.html

story:
Give Books to Your Neighbor on The Inside


I'm Ralph McCall, the Publisher at Destinee Media. One of our authors, Cass Tell came to me with an idea originating from his research on a new novel. He showed me some shocking statistics and I was deeply touched. We agreed that something has to be done.

Sadly, there are over 2.2 million people incarcerated in U.S. prisons. Prisons are lonely and dangerous places offering little hope.  One sheriff said, "They come out much worse than when they went in." That's true. Once released, two out of three prisoners will re-offend, which is a tragic burden for individuals and society.

In Matthew 25 we are challenged to care for prisoners when Jesus said, "I was in prison and you looked after me."

In considering this, how can we redeem lives?  Can prisoners be challenged to change their worldview and lifestyle? How can we encourage them?

In doing further research, we discovered that prisoners ask for books, everything from learning about business to spirituality. Books give knowledge and open new ideas. Yet, many prison libraries are in dire straights, lacking redemptive books.

Therefore, our goal is to give hope to these forgotten people by filling prisons with life-changing books.

Destinee Media is a not-for-profit organization. The goal is to give 2,200 thought-provoking books to prisoners at cost, and of course to give books to you for your donation. Just the books being given to prisoners have a bookstore retail value of over $32,000. Prisoners don't have the means to read eBooks, so they will receive paperback books.

We are working with a large prison support organization with extensive contacts. They will effectively put these books into the right hands.

This project is a drop in the bucket for what is really needed. If successful, we will consider a much larger project, to provide 2.2 million life-changing books to prisoners.

Please join with us to give hope to the Forgotten People. And, check out the 'Perks' you will receive when you contribute to this project.

Destinee Media
www.destineemedia.com

Books to be Given to Prisoners at Cost:

Entrepreneur: Bring Your Vision to Life, by Ralph McCall. As prisoners hope for change when they reenter the general population, this book helps them identify and plan for fulfillment of their vision. They specifically ask for books on how to start businesses.

If Only I Could Believe, by Wim Rietkerk. Because of tragic upbringings, many prisoners are cynical about life. This book can help them overcome the psychological barriers to spirituality and belief.

Beyond Identity, by Dick Keyes. This book deals with the question of “Who am I?” and goes to the very depths of humanity in defining ourselves.


Living Spiritual Rhythms Book 1, by Gregory J. Laughery. This is a book of stories, poems, and prayers leading to serious reflection and redemptive action. It centers on many of the emotions and thoughts a prisoner might be experiencing, such as sadness, trust and suspicion, courage and fear, love and justice.

Teachable Moments, by Kent McClain. Many prisoners have grown up in dysfunctional and abusive families. This book teaches how to build loving relationships with one’s children.

3 Theories of Everything, by Ellis Potter. In clear and compelling language, this book examines three worldviews, and the unique hope that each offers to humanity. It outlines how each worldview defines the ultimate purpose of our lives.

3 Teorias de Todo, by Ellis Potter. Three Theories of Everything in Spanish. U.S. prisons have many Spanish speaking inmates.

Pale Tides, a novel, by Cass Tell. A book that many prisoners will relate to. In this novel, the main character is excluded from society and longs for acceptance. Ensnared between opposing worlds, he sets out on a spiritual journey in search of truth and integrity.

story:
Greetings from the Freecandy confectionery!

Three years ago, armed only with a vision and belief in the capacity of creative ideas and the Arts, we created FREECANDY. In that time, FREECANDY has become one of Brooklyn's leading independent spaces for the showcase of emerging visual artists and performers. We cannot be prouder of what we've accomplished, but we would not be FREECANDY if we didn't keep pushing. 

With your help, our space will soon be reborn as Freecandy Creative Space (FCCS), Clinton Hill's first creative coworking space, photo studio and gallery and non-profit arts organization dedicated to the development of local emerging artists and independent creative professionals. FCCS will continue the original Freecandy mission, by convening a community of like-minded creatives under one roof, determined to make culture and develop innovative ideas.

As free creatives, we believe an open communal environment accelerates the process of creativity. FCCS will provide our members the requisite office tools and guided serendipity needed for ideas to be sparked and realized. In addition to daytime coworking, FCCS will also offers exclusive evening activities such as classes, talks and performances for our member community. 

What We Need & What You Get

Over the next 30 days, we are seeking to raise $60K to support the renovation of our space, add to our digital presence and provide the tools for our members to create, innovate and build. We've set up some great perks for your contribution, in addition to them being tax-deductible. 

    Our Impact

    For the past 3 years, Freecandy has provided a space for the showcase of emerging artists. We've hosted hundreds of shows for new artists who would otherwise, not have gotten the opportunity to show or perform their work. Now as a 501c3 non-profit arts organization, and with your assistance, we can expand our presence, with greater support for these artists, arts programs and classes for our community. 

    Globally recognized artists, renowned creatives and Grammy nominated performers all Freecandy home. With your help, we can do so much more! 

      Challenges

      As a non-profit arts organization, our primary challenge is garnering enough financial support to sustain our programs and make real impact in our community and the greater NYC area. We feel that with continued support, we can accomplish our mission to showcase the work of underexposed artists in underserved communities. 

        Other Ways You Can Help

        We love support in any way possible. The kind that folds is most necessary, but even if you can't give at this time, please help us by spreading the word to your friends. Our page has some great tools that make sharing our story easy.

story:
My name is Peter and I've just got back from a trip to Nepal where i was teaching English to school children. 

My campaign is pretty much a one-man battle at the moment, as the school I'm raising money for has no other help or support,- just me.....

Six dedicated teachers and Three hundred and Fifty underprivileged children aged 2-16 years old..... 

yes,- 350.

The term 'poor background' doesn't even come close to what some of these children have lived through.
Poverty stricken parents resort to selling their children in the hope that the child will have a better life. When that's your only remaining option, you know you're pretty desperate.
These kids end up living on the streets of Kathmandu for many different reasons. They waste their childhood wandering, begging, stealing, and being beaten by police and gangs.
Most children are introduced to glue-sniffing, prostitution, extreme violence and torture, and will inevitably die before reaching their thirtieth birthday.
If this was happening to the kid next-door to us, we'd do something. 
I'm asking, NO,- begging for anything you can give in order to help the school to take in more of these children. 
For only 145 English pounds, a child has a full year's scholarship which includes;
* 6 DAYS OF EDUCATION EVERY WEEK
* 3 MEALS EVERY SINGLE DAY
* THEIR OWN WARM BED
*CLEAN CLOTHES DAILY
and of course, safety.
I don't know many people who can just donate 145 pounds at the drop of a hat....... but if we all club together...... if we all just put a couple of quid into this pot of good will.......... if we all just give up that 20p coin we found on the bus seat this morning, we can save a child from the bad cards they've been dealt.
We wont get a 'thank you' letter from these children, and we won't be given a certificate to frame on our walls, but we WILL save a child's life. If this is enough to make you give something, anything, then please donate your pennies to this cause.

If you cannot spare a few pence, then perhaps you can still help by sharing this on your page in hope that others might just donate.
thank you,   Peter Kidd

story:
Our Story

Deep in the Himalayas, situated between the Nepali and Tibetan border, is a region called Dolpo. Dolpo's inhabitants live a 4 to 5 day grueling trek from the nearest airport at an altitude exceeding 13,000 feet. There are no roads in or out.  There is no electricity, plumbing, running water, or other modern amenities.


Himalaya Project NFP is a Chicago-based, all-volunteer, 501(c)3 charity, dedicated to providing education and healthcare to this underserved Himalayan region of Dolpo, Nepal. 

In 2010, we were asked by Amchi Namgyal Rinpoche, current president of the Himalayan Amchi Association (HAA), to assist him and the communities in Dolpo, Nepal, to start a school for Tibetan medicine in the Tarap Valley, high in the Himalaya.

The people in this region of Nepal have maintained their Buddhist practices, culture and identity for over a millennium.  But due to recent socioeconomic and geopolitical factors, they are left without access to basic health care as the number of Tibetan medicine practitioners has declined.

Infant/mother mortality rates are high, life expectancy is low, and may suffer from easily treatable diseases, as they are no longer enough doctors of Tibetan medicine in the region to treat the members of the community.

We are going to change that.

Rather than send doctors from the West to the East, our mission is to empower local communities by providing vocational training in Tibetan medicine to local community members in the region.

By supporting our project, you will help implement a 5-year school to train individual practitioners in traditional Tibetan medicine  in Dolpo.  

You will ensure that these underserved mountain communities in Nepal have access to affordable healthcare for a lifetime.  

You will help preserve the unique and rare practices of Tibetan medicine so they are not lost to the world.

What We Have

·  Non-Profit Status  - Himalaya Project NFP, is a registered 501(c)3 public charity

·  School Building- We are fortunate to already have our building, which would cost     $50,000 to build new

·  Curriculum - We already have the curriculum for a 5-year Tibetan medicine vocational program, as outlined by the Nepali government’s technical and vocational training department in conjunction with the Nepali Himalayan Amchi Association

·  Connections far and wide in the Tibetan medicine community, including a partnership with the Director of the Himalayan Amchi Association, Amchi Namgyal Rinpoche


What We Need

·  $60,000 USD, in sum, will run our school for 5 years and includes the cost of the teachers' salary, students' tuition, room and board, school supplies.

·  This is a small fraction of what it would take to do something similar in the West and the benefits are incalculable.

·  In order to start the project in the next two years, our goal is to raise half of $60,000 USD, which is $ 30,000 USD.. enough to start our school within the next two years.

With your help we can reach our goal of $30,000 in 30 days, and open the doors to our school within the next two years!


$30K in 30 Days!


What You Get

As a thank you gift for your generosity, we have some great perks in the side-bar for each level of donation.  All the items are crafted in Nepal and were hand-picked by one of our volunteers on the ground in Kathmandu. Adding one of these artisanal thank you gifts to your home will not only bring color and light to your home, but will remind you of your generosity in helping those less fortunate.



The Impact

With the funding we receive, we will accept 14 students from 7 mountain villages and train them at our school.  The 5-year intensive program will be lead by skilled teachers of Tibetan medicine.  Upon completion of our program, each of these 7 mountain villages will have 2 doctors, and access to healthcare.

Currently, infant/mother mortality rates are high, life expectancy is low, and many people suffer from easily treatable illnesses, as there are too few Tibetan medical doctors in the region to treat the population. 

Not only will we be providing our students with a trade and future livelihood, we will provide sustainable healthcare to an entire region of Nepal for a lifetime. 
By allowing for the conditions for a new generation to learn the practice of this form of medicine, the transmission and teachings of Tibetan medicine will not be lost and we ALL benefit. 

Medical anthropologists are attempting to document ancient forms of medicine so they are not lost, but are fighting a losing battle. Several of our Western drugs originate in nature and are based on plant derivatives. Even the heaviest hitters of our cancer drugs come from plants and trees.

In the future, we will study and collect public health numbers on our school to see just how much benefit our school provides to the region. 

Risks & Challenges

Due to recent socio-economic and geopolitical factors of the last 50 years, Dolpo has changed rapidly, which is part of the problem.  Many times when traditional cultures transition to modernity the baby is thrown out with the bathwater, meaning that everything traditional is left behind, even when it is relevant and useful to the community at hand, or in this case, to the rest of the world.  

Formerly, the economy of Dolpo was based on barter/trade.  As the economy has shifted towards using the Nepali currency in exchange for goods and services, this has put a large strain on the practice of Tibetan medicine, as the local community members cannot afford to really pay for the services of a Tibetan medicine practitioner.  

We will put great effort into finding creative solutions for our future practitioners, so they are able to make a living for themselves and their families.  

Members of our advisory board are located in Dolpo and others are specialists regarding this region of the world.  They will help us navigate through some of these challenges with sensitivity and  intelligence.

The first language of Dolpo is Tibetan.  Our board members are actively pursuing Tibetan language study at the University of Chicago to better facilitate communication and operate without a translator.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are a student or simply do not have the means to contribute, but are inspired by our project, there are many ways you can help.

Most pressing would be for you to spread this campaign as wide and as far as you can possibly send it.  Share it with your friends on social media, tell your co-workers, family, friends. Make some noise about this campaign.  It means something to many!

Click on the Indiegogo share tools at the bottom of this page to get started.  Share as widely and as often as you possibly can!  Every click to our page is an opportunity to make a difference in the lives of others.

story:
~**~~*--------------------------------------------------*~~**~

My name is Jess Cornelius and my dream is to become a special effects makeup artist and creature sculptor in the film industry. I am going into my Junior year of college completing my BFA in Film Production at Santa Fe University of Art and Design. I plan to finish out my degree here at SFUAD and then continue my studies in Toronto, ON for a degree in Complete Makeup Artistry for Film.

Visit my website for my showreel and portfolio!

                  

Every semester I get the opportunity to work on student films as their makeup artist, and a lot of the time the director will budget out a little bit for some cheap makeup to use on their actors; a large reason in me starting this fundraiser. If I have my own professional makeup kit then I can assure the director my best work with the makeup I know and am used to using. At The Film School (at Santa Fe University of Art and Design) we put on what is called Shoot the Stars. Shoot the Stars allows students to fill every position a professional film crew in Hollywood would have and to carry out the filming of a student written screenplay with an all SAG cast. Last fall I had the opportunity to work alongside a professional makeup artist on this production and learned a great deal about working in a fast paced environment behind the scenes as a makeup artist. 

  

Learn more about Shoot the Stars here-

This Fall I hope to get the chance to do this again, and hopefully with your help! I need your assistance to make my first large financial step towards reaching my dream of becoming a special effects makeup artist and creature sculptor for big time movies! 

If I can reach my goal here, this money will be used to purchase a nice professional makeup case, a brush belt to use in fast paced productions as well as the professional-grade makeup I need to fill the case.

I plan to purchase a case similar to this here

Other Ways You Can Help

I would certainly appreciate any amount of donation, if I can make my goal I am going to be one incredibly grateful girl. Please help a fellow aspiring artist spread the word about this fundraiser! Thanks so much!

-Jessica Cornelius

story:
Equipping Children TODAY for TOMORROW'S world!

At Grásta Christian School we believe in getting our students "TECH READY" as the world they live in depends more and more on the advances in technology just within their everyday life.  We start them young (at 4 years of age) all the way through to graduation (usually 17 years of age).  We want our students to have a head-start when they leave us and go on to further education and the workplace.
However, as a small, fee-funded, school we know we need help to ensure that there are enough computers available for both staff and students.
Our Goal is Simple!
Our goal for this year is to raise enough money to purchase TEN Acer Chromebooks - which will help greatly with our Google for Schools and Scratch programs among others.
You CAN Help!
Please consider making a donation to this fund or, if you cannot donate financially, please consider sharing this fundraiser with people you know!
THANK YOU!

story:
The story in brief


My name is Hanitra and I am an artist from Madagascar.  I have been working as a musician and toured around the world for almost 22 years playing music from my country. I have made 12 albums and my music is used in more than 10 films.

Time Magazine pronounced my band to be one of the ten best bands on the planet
Promoting, preserving traditional music, arts and culture is my main focus to empower people.

In May 2011, I got myself involved in an environmental project to preserve Madagascar's unique fauna and flora and launched a platform called Artists & Environment to encourage artists  of all different backgrounds and disciplines to take part in motivating people to act against the degradation of the environment.

Last April 2014, Warner Brothers released a documentary film called Island of lemurs - a beautiful film that portrays the life of lemurs, which my music has been used in. The film was made by IMAX production and it features Mr. Morgan Freeman as the narrator of the documentary. I encourage you to go out and see it.


Inspired by Arts Centres in Great Britain, I built the first ever Malagasy Arts Centre Antshow Madagascar in the capital of Antananarivo and am now embarking on building a one-stop Eco Mud House to be used as a cultural, environmental and social meeting place in a rural area called: Fenoarivo, Soavinandriana district, in the region of Itasy. The house will be built entirely with locally sourced materials with no machinery involved. Environmentally friendly, the house is to be a model home for the local countryside people to copy from.

This is very important to me because in our country, tradition, arts and cultural heritage are disappearing and our environment is degrading. People of rural areas are the guardians of tradition and building the Eco Mud House will be able to bring the community together. Re-learning old building techniques, there will be a transfer of knowledge from old to young. The house will be used for so many purposes focusing on educational, social and environmental issues. It will encourage the exchange from urban to rural living, local to international and vice versa.

Your help is very valuable because with your involvement, the community and their village will no longer be completely remote. People have no means of connection, no source of information therefore no exposure outside of their world. Opening up to the world will be a great help to this village that is so rich in agriculture, arts and culture. Our main aim is to develop rural tourism in this area for which the Eco Mud House will also be used.

The Eco Mud House

The two-storey mud-house will follow exactly the traditional Malagasy way of building in the highlands of Madagascar. There will be 5 rooms, a kitchen, a dinning room for everyone and a workshop space for arts and crafts. The wall is entirely made with mud, the storeys held with mud sandwiched between timbers, the roof will be thatched using local reeds, bamboos and timber.

It is located in Fenoarivo, Soavinandriana. Four hours only drive from the capital of Antananarivo yet so many villagers have not set foot in the capital.   

How it works

    We are now fundraising to help us finish the house which was started on the 12th July 2014. According to the traditional Mpanandro (local astrologer) that full moon day was the perfect day to start our project. But no work is possible without water, as a mud house is made out of water, mud and wood!

    • $7000 will help to get the house entirely built before the rainy season in October 2014. This amount includes the salary for ten men working 3 days a week from 12th July until 20th October on cob making, collecting water from afar, food and drink, building the wooden structure, reeds collection and thatching the roof.
    • $3000 will help to get our drinking water source cleaned, pumped up closer to the village so that women do not have to spend hours to fetch it. We are also restoring an old pond to get water for building and agriculture purposes.
    • $2000 will help to get access to more land and some fruit trees and endemic trees re-planted on the barren hill around the Eco Mud House. I have visited the Green Belt Movements of Kenya and will apply some good practices from the movement here.

The Impact

Your contribution will:

  • Help the elders to share and transfer their knowledge happily to the younger generation.
  • Make malagasy country women very happy since they will have different work to do other than fetching water all day.
  • Make malagasy country men proud to show off their traditional house building skills.
  • Create new jobs and bring new life to the village of Fenoarivo.
  • Restore pride and dignity to the whole community of Fenoarivo.


Risks & Challenges

Destruction of the environment like cutting down the forests, erosion, water problems, lack of schools, sanitary and basic infrastructure and simply being so remote are some of the risks and challenges we are facing while building this one-stop Eco Mud House. 

Having started with nothing myself and now ending up being a great ambassador of Madagascar's music, culture and environmental projects, I want to challenge this. 

The community of Fenoarivo is a very hard working community who are eager to learn and meet new people. Their land is fertile and the landscape is beautiful. Everything is there for them to thrive, except that they need a leader and a role model to guide their path to life improvement and success. We can use the Eco Mud House as the heart of their village, which normally no one would want to visit for longer than 2 hours - even myself! The village has great potential to produce organic food and the area has so much to offer for tourism - the younger generations deserve better and this could be their opportunity.

    Would you like to help this village thrive?

    We would appreciate any help you can bring to this project, big or small. You can also help us by:

    • Spreading the word and sharing our page with your friends via the Indiegogo easy sharing tools.
    • Visiting us - come and stay as a volunteer to help! There is so much work to be done but it's in a very friendly and beautiful environment. If you like adventures, you will find so much to do here. 
    • Letting us know if you would like to be involved in anyway at all. Thank you.
story_txt:
The story in brief

My name is Hanitra and I am an artist from Madagascar.  I have been working as a musician and toured around the world for almost 22 years playing music from my country. I have made 12 albums and my music is used in more than 10 films.
Time Magazine pronounced my band to be one of the ten best bands on the planetPromoting, preserving traditional music, arts and culture is my main focus to empower people.
In May 2011, I got myself involved in an environmental project to preserve Madagascar's unique fauna and flora and launched a platform called Artists & Environment to encourage artists  of all different backgrounds and disciplines to take part in motivating people to act against the degradation of the environment.
Last April 2014, Warner Brothers released a documentary film called Island of lemurs - a beautiful film that portrays the life of lemurs, which my music has been used in. The film was made by IMAX production and it features Mr. Morgan Freeman as the narrator of the documentary. I encourage you to go out and see it.


Inspired by Arts Centres in Great Britain, I built the first ever Malagasy Arts Centre Antshow Madagascar in the capital of Antananarivo and am now embarking on building a one-stop Eco Mud House to be used as a cultural, environmental and social meeting place in a rural area called: Fenoarivo, Soavinandriana district, in the region of Itasy. The house will be built entirely with locally sourced materials with no machinery involved. Environmentally friendly, the house is to be a model home for the local countryside people to copy from.



This is very important to me because in our country, tradition, arts and cultural heritage are disappearing and our environment is degrading. People of rural areas are the guardians of tradition and building the Eco Mud House will be able to bring the community together. Re-learning old building techniques, there will be a transfer of knowledge from old to young. The house will be used for so many purposes focusing on educational, social and environmental issues. It will encourage the exchange from urban to rural living, local to international and vice versa.

Your help is very valuable because with your involvement, the community and their village will no longer be completely remote. People have no means of connection, no source of information therefore no exposure outside of their world. Opening up to the world will be a great help to this village that is so rich in agriculture, arts and culture. Our main aim is to develop rural tourism in this area for which the Eco Mud House will also be used.



The Eco Mud House


The two-storey mud-house will follow exactly the traditional Malagasy way of building in the highlands of Madagascar. There will be 5 rooms, a kitchen, a dinning room for everyone and a workshop space for arts and crafts. The wall is entirely made with mud, the storeys held with mud sandwiched between timbers, the roof will be thatched using local reeds, bamboos and timber.
It is located in Fenoarivo, Soavinandriana. Four hours only drive from the capital of Antananarivo yet so many villagers have not set foot in the capital.   
   How it works 
We are now fundraising to help us finish the house which was started on the 12th July 2014. According to the traditional Mpanandro (local astrologer) that full moon day was the perfect day to start our project. But no work is possible without water, as a mud house is made out of water, mud and wood!


$7000 will help to get the house entirely built before the rainy season in October 2014. This amount includes the salary for ten men working 3 days a week from 12th July until 20th October on cob making, collecting water from afar, food and drink, building the wooden structure, reeds collection and thatching the roof.
$3000 will help to get our drinking water source cleaned, pumped up closer to the village so that women do not have to spend hours to fetch it. We are also restoring an old pond to get water for building and agriculture purposes.
$2000 will help to get access to more land and some fruit trees and endemic trees re-planted on the barren hill around the Eco Mud House. I have visited the Green Belt Movements of Kenya and will apply some good practices from the movement here.



  The Impact 
Your contribution will:

Help the elders to share and transfer their knowledge happily to the younger generation.
Make malagasy country women very happy since they will have different work to do other than fetching water all day.
Make malagasy country men proud to show off their traditional house building skills.
Create new jobs and bring new life to the village of Fenoarivo.
Restore pride and dignity to the whole community of Fenoarivo.





  Risks & Challenges  
Destruction of the environment like cutting down the forests, erosion, water problems, lack of schools, sanitary and basic infrastructure and simply being so remote are some of the risks and challenges we are facing while building this one-stop Eco Mud House. 
Having started with nothing myself and now ending up being a great ambassador of Madagascar's music, culture and environmental projects, I want to challenge this. 
The community of Fenoarivo is a very hard working community who are eager to learn and meet new people. Their land is fertile and the landscape is beautiful. Everything is there for them to thrive, except that they need a leader and a role model to guide their path to life improvement and success. We can use the Eco Mud House as the heart of their village, which normally no one would want to visit for longer than 2 hours - even myself! The village has great potential to produce organic food and the area has so much to offer for tourism - the younger generations deserve better and this could be their opportunity.


  Would you like to help this village thrive? 
We would appreciate any help you can bring to this project, big or small. You can also help us by:

Spreading the word and sharing our page with your friends via the Indiegogo easy sharing tools.
Visiting us - come and stay as a volunteer to help! There is so much work to be done but it's in a very friendly and beautiful environment. If you like adventures, you will find so much to do here. 
Letting us know if you would like to be involved in anyway at all. Thank you.

story:
Our Economy is Evolving, so is Education

We believe educators are one of the keys to that evolution. Educators are the best judges as to what works in a classroom setting. Agog reader app is a tool to empower educators to find, identify, and share which lessons and techniques work best to facilitate the evolution of the classroom to prepare students to meet the needs of our changing economy:

  • Agog Designer and Developer Allison McEntire is from a family of educators giving her a lifetime of experience in academe with 10 years as a classroom educator. Allison has been developing websites since the 1990s.
  • There is no silver bullet to fixing a problem as complex as changing our education system, but the power of mobile technology allows us to create tools that can meet the scale of the problem while focusing on solving individual issues -- Example: Finding the best lesson plans for our changing economy.
  • Your support will help us realize our vision by getting Agog into every mobile phone platform so we can reach every teacher with a smart phone and internet connection.
  • Your support will help us integrate Agog into the educator's social media experience. When teachers spread the word about Agog they can begin to identify and share the best lesson plans.
  • Most importantly, your support helps us keep Agog free for teachers, forever.
  • Upon launching the first beta test in April, Agog was downloaded hundreds of times in 16 countries around the world! Your help can make that number grow exponentially!

What We Need

As a free resource for educators we do not plan to profit from Agog, so in order to move Agog forward we set a minimum goal of $6,300 and 1000's of mobile downloads. Here is the breakdown:



  • If we exceed our goal we have a plan for that. We intend to improve our taxonomy and search functions, add social media integration and continue to maintain Agog as a free resource.
  • If we fall short of our goal all funds raised will go to Agog Development, Indiegogo, and perks.
  • In addition to funding please tell us what you think.  We really value your feedback and think everyone can have a say to help make Agog the World's best mobile lesson plan resource!

$25 Gift: Agog Education Honor Roll

Without great teachers we would not be able to create awesome apps and the campaigns to get them out to the world. Because we recognize how important teachers are to our lives we created the Agog Education Honor Roll so we can recognize and thank teachers and schools. As long as Agog is an app for educators we will host this honor roll in Agog reader so our donors of $25 can honor and thank a teacher who made an impact in their life.  

How it Works:

  • After you donate we will email you a form to fill out about your favorite teacher. 
  • You then fill it out and email it back.
  • After we receive your form the teacher's name, school and state will be posted on our Education Honor Roll
  • Your nominated teacher also gets a "read more" page with a short bio or story, pic (if okay), and your name if you choose to share that.
  • We send a letter to the school (if you provide the address), care of the educator you nominate to let them know that you have nominated them and where to find Agog
  • Visitor's can browse the Honor Roll or search alphabetically by last name or by State or Province


Back to School Perks!

To be intensely interested in something is to be agog and it is at the heart of pedagogy, the science of education. We wanted our perks to reflect Agog's place in education. Our perks make great gifts for students, teachers, parents and lovers of education alike!


About Agog Appreciation Page

We created an appreciation page in Agogreader.com to highlight our generous donors. With levels from Associate to Emeritus your donation will get your business or organization logo or your personal brand displayed prominently as a key supporter of Agog with a link to your webpage. As long as Agog is an app for teachers you will have a place on our appreciation page.

Appreciation Page will Display in order:

  • Emeritus Donors $50,000+
  • Doctorate Donors $10,000 
  • Master Donors $5,000 
  • Bachelor Donors $1,000 
  • Associate Donors $500


The Impact

Agog is just one educational tool of many, but it is an important missing piece! We believe the ripple effect of a mobile app like Agog can have a far reaching impact.

Consider how Agog can impact:

  • Traditional Classrooms
  • Experimental Classrooms
  • Online Classrooms
  • Hybrid Classrooms
  • Montessori Classes
  • Cloud based Schools
  • Home School
  • Incarcerated Students
  • Student Teachers
  • Teaching Assistants
  • Tutors
  • Parents
  • Remedial Reference for Students
  • Test Preparation
  • and many more

We believe Agog has application in nearly every imaginable classroom setting.


What People are Saying About Agog


Risks & Challenges

We have tried to keep Agog a low-risk, high-reward for teachers kind of project, but there are always risks and challenges.

  • Development can take longer than expected.
  • Development can be more expensive than expected.
  • Software updates can cause setbacks.
  • Agog is fast-growing and now has thousands of lesson plans causing general maintenance and tracking of potential spam to be more and more challenging.
  • We have been told we are "over-secure" but that is because we take security risks seriously and we will continue to do so.

Other Ways You Can Help

Like Agog? Wish you could donate but just can't right now? You can still help:

  • Download our app for your Apple device or visit agogreader.com!
  • Leave us a 5 Start rating and positive feedback in the app store!
  • With the Indiegogo share tools you can help us get the word out about Agog!
  • Send us your name and a quote as to why you think Agog is awesome and we might share it here!


Agogreader.com is a service of Eudaemonia Equality Project LLC -- eepapps.com -- We Make Apps For People Who Fight Poverty!

story:
Short Summary

Mayor Bill de Blasio received $340 million from the State of New York to invest in early childhood education programming, beginning this Fall.  Has the Mayor visited an authentic Montessori classroom to see for himself what Montessori is and how it works?  If not, why not?


We will fly an aerial banner in the sky over New York City for three hours on Friday, May 2nd. Our goal is simple: entice Mayor de Blasio to visit a Montessori classroom.


Authentic Montessori provides the very best return on investment for the child, as well as for the citizens of the State of New York.

What We Need & What You Get

We have a short window of time to get our message out.  The Mayor is allocating those funds as we speak.  Therefore, the banner will fly next Friday, May 2nd, for three hours.

So, what do you get for your contribution?  You get the knowledge and self-satisfaction that because of your contribution this banner went sailing! If all goes as planned we'll send a high-quality picture of the banner alongside the NYC skyline to our contributors.

The Impact

We expect a few million people will see this banner...and hopefully, the Mayor himself.  One thing is certain: 100 years after Dr. Maria Montessori dazzled the world with her breakthrough educational methods for young children, early childhood education is finally being embraced by politicians, economists, psychologists.  Montessori is the answer to the question, "What does high quality early childhood education look like?"  Next Friday, when New Yorkers look up, many will see the word "Montessori" for the first time. Help them take this first step on a wonderful journey that will improve the lives of children everywhere.

SaveOther Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to make a contribution now, but have a twitter account, when next Friday May 2nd rolls around, tweet "Bill de Blasio: Make It Montessori!"  Let's see how much fun we can mobilize in the Montessori world in 7 days.

story:
The Problem

Imagine walking into a school with row after row of empty shelves and the span of knowledge available to you was just 30 books? This is the case for millions of students in developing countries around the world whose schools have only a handful of books and where there are no libraries to fill the gap. Imagine entering an elementary school in your community where 1 in 4 children grow up without learning how to read.

We believe that is one child too many and that everyone deserves access to a library of books. 

Our Solution

Library For All and Pi Phi envision a world without barriers to knowledge. We see an opportunity to work together to provide communities with access to quality books and educational resources. LFA has designed a digital Library platform that makes books available to students at a much lower cost than building physical libraries. The Library is made accessible through mobile phone networks, and on any device already available to those in developing countries such as low-cost tablets, PCs and $30 feature phones. 

Pi Beta Phi is a national organization with a passion for literacy and education. NYU Pi Phis are dedicated to working within the community to instill a lifelong love of reading that can unlock true potential and create a more literate and productive society.

Now we need your help!

    The Campaign

    Over the next week, NYU's Pi Phi Chapter will be running a Read-a-Thon campaign to raise awareness of and funding for Library For All and The Pi Beta Phi Foundation. We are asking for your support in this campaign. 

    Here's how it works: for every dollar raised on this platform, the Pi Phi girls will commit to reading one more page during the Read-a-Thon. The goal is to get every Pi Phi reading as much as possible. The Chapter has also pledged a goal to read half the pages in service through tutoring, teaching and reading with children.

    Challenge us to read more by helping us raise more!

      Want to know more?.

      Visit Library For All's website at: visit www.libraryforall.org and the Pi Beta Phi Foundation’s website at: https://www.pibetaphifoundation.org/about

      Please support our reading and join us on our journey to transform global education!
