story:
Short Summary

BIO Farming Manager-is an application that helps farmers accelerate their knowledge about agroecology(in terms of strategies, know-how and certified practices),  gives  a step by step guidance on all the farming processes(from initial investment to  actual profit) and also helps them measure and manage their business !

We are currently working on launching this application as a  web/mobile software platform with free tools dedicated to the BIO (organic) farmers that will actively manage the rotation plan of the crops in BIO system( just like "playing organic FarmVille" but with real data :), and develop premium features with integration of  big data analysis from their geospatial location with the help of a smart sensors kit (all depending on the nature of the crops and the size of the plots and the number of their farm’s animals and type) !

(* Note: this is a real screenshot from the prototype you will be able to use if you contribute by donating and/or sharing  (to)the campaign that is actually a custom excel file)

The tools will enable the BIO(organic) farmer to:
  • accelerate his knowledge of  agro-ecology in terms of know-how and  practiced(certified) strategies through a step by step guidance
  • choose the right crop rotation strategy in order  to make use of  his local resources  to maximize  income potential/plot/crop
  • learn to focus on that one metric that matters at the right time(diversify or increase productivity vs expand)
  • make use of the designed structure to search and find the right business model in order to use  a learn/practice routine a BIO farmer needs in order to make sustainable profits

                 

                     

                         

What the organic farmers say about the product?

Alexandru DUMBRAVA:

      www.biodumbrava.ro

” Being able to run multiple scalable income/productivity scenarios with real data and compare their output is probably the greatest unfair advantage a small business can have in order to achieve  product market fit based on their own resources, I found the BIO FARMING  MANAGER to be a great and useful tool for my business! ”


What We Need & What You Get

Basically we need a min. budget of 15.000$ seed money to get us started with the infrastructure of the platform for the tools developed so far (that reflect a 2 years sum of countless hours of R&D-(Research and Development)) and ensure enough budget for running the platform and finance the R&D for the premium features in order for the project to selfsustain itself. 


You get to use in advance our existing desktop prototype that gives you a competitive advantage and will accelerate your knowledge and understanding of organic farming and its business potential !

Front-end preview of the prototype...

Back-end preview of the prototype ...


The future platform will enable the users to get access to the  tools online, and  will give a step by step guidance by helping the organic farmers achieve product-market fit related to their own resources and enable them through its specific structure to create their own database in order for the tools to be more accurate by  establishing  a build/measure/learn practical routine that is essential to any     start-up.


    The Impact

    This project has 3 main objectives:
    •  increasing the social impact of organic farmers and helping them achieve sustainable growth by providing them online tools that will help them manage their own small business and increase productivity and profits(by creating a win/win situation : the more money they make -the more money we make ... :)
    • decreasing the high unemployment percentage (%) rate in the rural communities by encouraging people to start their own small agriculture business farms 
    • educate people about the benefits of agroecology (in terms of humans health with benefits on cancer prevention, social health in terms of the economy-generating self employed people or small business owners, and planet health in terms of reducing the carbon footprint with sustainable agricultural practices).

      Risks & Challenges

      As we all know no business plan/income projection survives first contact with customers/market, but that doesn't mean we can't keep an open mind about iterating our model until the suitable solution replaces our initial estimation and generates an acceptable percentage (%) of error in our plan. So our future struggle will focus on:

      • educating the organic farmers about the benefits of proper planning (plan A/B/C+contingency-crop insurance and/or mutual funds) and taking "educated guesses" with the help of our tools rather than using a magic crystall ball and blame the results on the economy
      • ensuring product market fit for the premium features (so that their added value to the free tools will generate 10+ times  the value and then some :) for the investment of the organic farmers).

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

      • Help us spread the word out and make some noise about our campaign :)
      • How,  you dare to ask? simply  use the Indiegogo share tools !

      And that's all there is to it ! :)

      P.S.-as a reward to your precious help, 30 days after the campaign has ended we will treat you as one of our penny stock investors with all the benefits(including the use of the prototype through a remote desktop viewer for 30min.), just drop us an e-mail at biofarmingtool@gmail.com with the link where you shared and/or advertised our campaign ... pam pam :) and we will get in touch with you shortly to schedule your reward :),  or better yet enter your e-mail here !

      P.P.S.- as a special prize to the link that had the most conversions to donations and/or shares to the campaign(after the due diligence period of 30 days) we will reward you with the VIP perk(reward) !

      Have more questions?

      It doesn't matter the subject(about the perks=rewards, what the prototype actually does, how it does it, anything that is unclear to you ... ) just use the comment area and we will get back to you asap !

      Why contribute?

      -if you are an organic farmer making a contribution is like helping to build your own personal IT assistant the more you give the more capable he will be :)
      -if you are an aspiring entrepreneur or a social impact project enthusiast only by  making a donation it will create enough empathy for you to follow up on your investment and enable you to actually learn from this process and who knows may be one day you will ask for money for your own project and you would not seem hypocrite if you had made at least one contribution before :) !
story_txt:
Short Summary

BIO Farming Manager-is an application that helps farmers accelerate their knowledge about agroecology(in terms of strategies, know-how and certified practices),  gives  a step by step guidance on all the farming processes(from initial investment to  actual profit) and also helps them measure and manage their business ! We are currently working on launching this application as a  web/mobile software platform with free tools dedicated to the BIO (organic) farmers that will actively manage the rotation plan of the crops in BIO system( just like "playing organic FarmVille" but with real data :), and develop premium features with integration of  big data analysis from their geospatial location with the help of a smart sensors kit (all depending on the nature of the crops and the size of the plots and the number of their farm’s animals and type) !(* Note: this is a real screenshot from the prototype you will be able to use if you contribute by donating and/or sharing  (to)the campaign that is actually a custom excel file)The tools will enable the BIO(organic) farmer to:
accelerate his knowledge of  agro-ecology in terms of know-how and  practiced(certified) strategies through a step by step guidance


choose the right crop rotation strategy in order  to make use of  his local resources  to maximize 
income potential/plot/crop

learn to focus on that one metric that matters at the right
time(diversify or increase productivity vs expand)

make
use of the designed structure to search and find the right business model in
order to use  a learn/practice routine a
BIO farmer needs in order to make sustainable profits

                 

                     
                         

What the organic farmers say about the product?Alexandru DUMBRAVA:      www.biodumbrava.ro
” Being able to run multiple scalable income/productivity scenarios with real data and compare their output is probably the greatest unfair advantage a small business can have in order to achieve  product market fit based on their own resources, I found the BIO FARMING  MANAGER to be a great and useful tool for my business! ”


What We Need & What You Get Basically we need a min. budget of 15.000$ seed money to get us started with the infrastructure of the platform for the tools developed so far (that reflect a 2 years sum of countless hours of R&D-(Research and Development)) and ensure enough budget for running the platform and finance the R&D for the premium features in order for the project to selfsustain itself. 


You get to use in advance our existing desktop prototype that gives you a competitive advantage and will accelerate your knowledge and understanding of organic farming and its business potential !
Front-end preview of the prototype...



Back-end preview of the prototype ...

The future platform will enable the users to get access to the  tools online, and  will give a step by step guidance by helping the organic farmers achieve product-market fit related to their own resources and enable them through its specific structure to create their own database in order for the tools to be more accurate by  establishing  a build/measure/learn practical routine that is essential to any     start-up.



  The Impact This project has 3 main objectives:

 increasing the social impact of organic farmers and helping them achieve sustainable growth by providing them online tools that will help them manage their own small business and increase productivity and profits(by creating a win/win situation : the more money they make -the more money we make ... :)
decreasing the high unemployment percentage (%) rate in the rural communities by encouraging people to start their own small agriculture business farms 

educate people about the benefits of agroecology (in terms of humans health with benefits on cancer prevention, social health in terms of the economy-generating self employed people or small business owners, and planet health in terms of reducing the carbon footprint with sustainable agricultural practices).



  Risks & Challenges  As we all know no business plan/income projection survives first contact with customers/market, but that doesn't mean we can't keep an open mind about iterating our model until the suitable solution replaces our initial estimation and generates an acceptable percentage (%) of error in our plan. So our future struggle will focus on:

educating the organic farmers about the benefits of proper planning (plan A/B/C+contingency-crop insurance and/or mutual funds) and taking "educated guesses" with the help of our tools rather than using a magic crystall ball and blame the results on the economy ensuring product market fit for the premium features (so that their added value to the free tools will generate 10+ times  the value and then some :) for the investment of the organic farmers). 
  Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help: 
Help us spread the word out and make some noise about our campaign :) How,  you dare to ask? simply  use the Indiegogo share tools ! 
 And that's all there is to it ! :)P.S.-as a reward to your precious help, 30 days after the campaign has ended we will treat you as one of our penny stock investors with all the benefits(including the use of the prototype through a remote desktop viewer for 30min.), just drop us an e-mail at biofarmingtool@gmail.com with the link where you shared and/or advertised our campaign ... pam pam :) and we will get in touch with you shortly to schedule your reward :),  or better yet enter your e-mail here !P.P.S.- as a special prize to the link that had the most conversions to donations and/or shares to the campaign(after the due diligence period of 30 days) we will reward you with the VIP perk(reward) !Have more questions?It doesn't matter the subject(about the perks=rewards, what the prototype actually does, how it does it, anything that is unclear to you ... ) just use the comment area and we will get back to you asap !
Why contribute?
-if you are an organic farmer making a contribution is like helping to build your own personal IT assistant the more you give the more capable he will be :)
-if you are an aspiring entrepreneur or a social impact project enthusiast only by  making a donation it will create enough empathy for you to follow up on your investment and enable you to actually learn from this process and who knows may be one day you will ask for money for your own project and you would not seem hypocrite if you had made at least one contribution before :) !

story:
Families in Somalia Need Homes and Clean Water

Since 1981, Somalia has been wracked with constant and ongoing civil war and unrest. Today, thousands of women and children are living in transient camps - sleeping in tents.

Imagine for a moment a rail thin young boy walking to his tent with a gallon bucket filled with water. When he arrives at his tent, he gives the water to his mother and siblings who are clinging to life - as they lack food, clean drinking water and medical care they need.
Unfortunately for this young boy and his family, this is daily life in Somalia. They don't know a different, safer and more fulfilling life. For them, there is no way out. When basic human needs go unmet, all other thoughts cease to exist. 
Havoyoco was founded in 1992 to address the basic needs of women and children in Somalia. Our mission is to provide basic human needs so the people of Somalia can develop the education, skills and ambition needed to help themselves out of poverty.
Our goal is to build homes for 120 families, dig two deep water wells to provide clean drinking water for these families, and to build a medical center and school. Our focus is to transform the lives of families, so they can enjoy basic human dignity and begin to think about opportunities to create a better future for themselves.
Funding Goal

We need funds to build a community for 120 families. 

  • Each home will cost $7,000 to build ($7,000 x 120 homes = $840,000)
  • Construction on the homes will begin in January 2015 and be finished in Decemeber 2015.
  • The medical clinic, school and deep water wells will cost $600,000.
  • The construction of the clinic, school and wells will begin in July 2016 and be complete by January 2018.
  • In January 2016, we will begin interviewing qualified families to begin filling the community and providing families with immediate access to permanent living accommodations.

Contributions to HAVOYOCO are deemed charitable under section 501(c)(3) of the internal revenue code as an organization described in Section 501(c)(3). U.S. Federal Tax ID 46-0745266. Please consult your accountant for any clarications.

The Impact

Since 1992, Havoyoco has helped meet basic humanitarian needs for refugees in Somalia. We currently operate in five countries, providing counseling, sanitation, education, and vocational training to men, women and youth in Somalia. We operate with the support of organizations like UNICEF and Oxfam, as well as the generosity of private donors.

When basic human needs - shelter, safety, food, clean water, medical treatment - go unmet, human instinct instructs a person to focus solely on survival. Havoyoco's Homes for Humanity project will provide for these basic needs to transform the lives of families in Somalia, so women and youth can begin to focus on education and honing skills so they can earn money and build lives for themselves and future generations. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand you may not be able to contribute financially. We value your thoughts and prayers, and humbly ask that you share our campaign with your family and friends.

story:
CELF needs to raise $20,000 within the next 60 days to guarantee sustainability education for 10,000 more students this year. Please Donate!

CELF (Children’s Environmental Literacy Foundation) brings sustainability education to K-12 schools... and that means relevant, real-world learning experiences that build on core academic skills. Through our teacher training and Student Ambassador program, CELF provides dynamic, creative, project-based learning opportunities that connect students to the world around them and to their future!

Right now CELF is at a critical time - your support means that we are able to reach more schools, teachers and students in New York and across the country.

        

Future  Environmental              Future Policy Makers                Future Chemist
             Engineers

Every Donation Will Be Matched:

Your gift will go even further, because the organizations below have pledged to match your donation. CELF is proud to work with the following match sponsors to date:

                                           

It's not too late to become a Match Sponsor!! Contact: katie@celfeducation.org

CELF teacher training and student programs:

  • Inspire students through innovative teaching to become knowledgeable, active citizens and responsible stewards of the environment.
  • Provide professional learning for teachers to use creative, innovative, hands-on tools to develop globally aware, active citizens of change.
  • Prepare the next generation with the knowledge and skills they will need to order to thrive and lead in our interdependent world
By reaching our goal, CELF can provide its accredited teacher training programs to 100 teachers over the next year, positively impacting 10,000 students!


 

The CELF Approach:

CELF uses a unique approach to connect students and their classroom experiences to the real world:

  • CELF utilizes the cutting edge Education for Sustainability (EfS) framework to train educators and enhance students' higher level thinking skills and commitment to learning school-wide.
  • CELF's approach builds on the foundation of Common Core and Next Generation Science Standards by engaging students in learning that prepares them for the 21st century.
  • CELF's programs work with teachers within the Common Core curriculum standards to develop systems thinking skills.
  • CELF integrates EfS into public and private school curriculum across all core subjects, beginning in kindergarten through twelfth grade.
  • CELF reinforces critical STEM (science, technology, engineering and math) skills and helps students make connections through real world application.
  • Students gain the knowledge, experience and leadership skills needed to bring all of us into a future that is smarter, healthier, greener and more sustainable.

“The CELF Institute totally changed my way of thinking both professionally and personally. It allowed me to collaborate in ways never before possible. I now totally understand what Education for Sustainability is.” – 5th grade teacher, Dobbs Ferry Public Schools, NY

“Adults are always telling us that change begins with us, the “young people.’ CELF helps us do exactly that – make and do good in the world, and enact change through education…CELF makes me feel as if I really do make a difference.” ----Sara, 11th grader, CELF Student Ambassador, Edgemont High School, NY

“The CELF program exceeded my highest expectations. You have inspired, challenged and equipped us for a tremendous school year filled with sustainability education programs for our students.” Dr. Steven Frantz, District Sustainability Coordinator, Former Principal Scarsdale School District, NY

                                    

                                    

    About CELF
  • CELF is a Nationally Recognized Leader in EfS.
  • CELF is part of the Clinton Global Initiative (CGI), recognized for its model programs.
  • CELF's CGI Commitment to Action project is in partnership with the New York City Department of Education Sustainability, Shelburne Farms Sustainable Schools Project and Manhattanville College School of Education. 
  • The Project has worked with 24 NYC schools, covering all five boroughs. 
  • CELF is cited as a leading exemplar in the newly released 2014 National Action Plan for Educating for Sustainability.

Help continue this legacy with your donation!

Check out the "perks" and feel the gratitude. Enjoy a gift of appreciation* or "pay it forward" with one of the perks that can make an enormous difference in the lives of others. Of course, the greatest thanks comes from the legacy your donation creates for our future.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Spread the  word about CELF and share a link to this campaign using Indiegogo's share tools
  • Let us hear from you katie@celfeducation.org
  • "Like" CELF on Facebook
  • "Follow" CELF on twitter
  •  For more information: www.celfeducation.org

*Perks generously provided by Eartheasy.

                                                          

CELF is a not-for-profit 501 c3 organization and is in its 3rd year of its Clinton  Global Initiative to Action with NYC public schools.

story:
Hi - My name is Marc Stephan Nkouly from Bamenda, Cameroon (located in the North West Region of the country). I'm a tech evangelist with many years experience working at a local cyber cafe. More than anything, I'm passionate about open source computing and the doors it can open for my community in Bamenda.

The cyber cafe is being sold and I have a great opportunity to ensure that the space is best utilized to empower the local community. With your help, I can purchase the facility and make it an open source cyber learning center to provide skills training to many people in the community, including many people who have few opportunities to get high quality training.

Update: With days remaining for this campaign, the initial goal is likely out of reach but that doesn't mean we can't use additional support from your networks as we have a few exciting developments to mention.

In fact, Stephan has strengthened his relationship with the current owner of the cyber café who is willing to sell the space for less than anticipated - 1.75 million CFA (roughly US $3,700). In other words, the owner has agreed to sell the business and building under an installment plan that is $2,500 less than initially thought.

  • The 1st 500 000 CFA (US $1,050) was paid on 18 Mar 2014 (last week) signifying the transfer of responsibility of the business. This is a great step forward!
  • The 2nd 750 000 CFA (US $1,600) will be paid by 18 June 2014 (3 months from now).
  • The 3rd 500 000 CFA (US $1,050) will be paid by 18 Sept 2014 (6 months from now) upon which will result the transfer of the property through deed of sale.

We are not sure how the next couple of months will proceed, but all funds raised from here out will go toward the June 18th payment for the cyber café. An offline campaign is also in progress to raise awareness for the need to fund Marc Stephan's dream to empower the community of Bamenda.

Introduction

"The child destined to invent the next version of the internet could be without a computer right now. We need to change that." - Ken Starks, Reglue.org
Empowerment is about having the ability to use knowledge, to make decisions on your own behalf, and to improve the society. In today's world, computing skills are crucial. We are making Cameroon into an information society and a regional leader in ICT business and tech incubation. Training centers in the area currently act as "train and go" rather than "train and grow." Many people are reluctant to come in. Users may learn to surf the Internet or use social media but they do not stay to learn lifelong knowledge. Better access to information means developing abilities to solve problems facing society. Computer education builds self-esteem and can be a great outlet for creativity and teamwork.

Youth using computers at the cafe

Background

"What the whole world wants is a good job." - Jim Clifton, Gallup CEO

Our vision is that community empowerment can happen through the use low-cost computers and free software. Specifically, we are proposing an innovative, community-based and community-driven information and communication center that emphasizes the importance of using a wide range of technologies for critical thinking. It will make a significant contribution to building a more inclusive society. The center will cater to all groups, including people who are poor, disabled, or marginalized for other reasons. In short, it will address the diverse needs of the majority of the people in the Bamenda region.

Here's why we need it:

In developing countries, most workers earn a living through agriculture or domestic service. A living wage is hard to come by. Poor infrastructure makes it difficult to create new jobs. Fortunately, the Internet is changing the cycle of poverty as people are able to develop skills that allow them to create new forms of business that tie-in with the global economy.

Mobile phones are common in the North West region of Cameroon but few young people have an environment whether they can learn useful computer skills. Schools lack an ICT curriculum and most cyber cafes do not provide training. Few Cameroonians know how to use a computer to find a job, launch their own business, or learn about the world. 

There are several groups of people who could benefit from a more socially oriented model of computer based learning and employment. People who are poor and vulnerable are particularly affected, but also have strengths and opportunities. In developing nations like Cameroon, youth (those under 30), women, people living with disabilities and chronic illnesses are often seeking employment but face discrimination and disproportionately high unemployment rates.

Women are welcomed with open arms to use the cafe

Some people have never had the opportunity to use a computer, and now don’t have the courage to enter an internet cafe. Many others, who do have the courage to come to a cybercafe, don't even have basic understandings of computers and the internet. Those who do come and do research on a topic (usually related to what they do offline) are expecting the internet, through a search engine, to give them the answer. Unfortunately, when they don't find the kind of answer they were hoping for, they feel reluctant to come next time.

From these observations, we have seen the need to create a safe and inclusive space for people to admit they don’t know about computers so they can learn more.

In an ideal educational system, these people would have acquired the skills they need to be comfortable with the internet and computers at school and at home as they grow up. Unfortunately, the education system in developing countries such as Cameroon’s is not adequate. There are many youth who went to professional training centers but who fail to translate their learning into jobs. This group could also be useful mentors and trainers to those who are just learning about ICT.

In addition, there is a group of people who have learned extensive ICT skills on their own in informal environments but who cannot leverage their knowledge, because they don't have any certificate to demonstrate what they know. This lack of credential precludes them from obtaining better jobs. There is a need for a competency-based certificate program that would assist this group to move into jobs in the ICT and related sectors.

This new community based/social business will address these needs and opportunities.

What's needed

Once the physical space is purchased under an installment plan (1 750 000 CFA, or US $3,700), the need will be to fill it with the right tools to train the local community. Though the current HP desktop computers in the cyber cafe will be sold with the business, they are aging fast and are not energy-efficient by today's standards. The furniture will remain, as it is still suitable to a computer learning center.

Current computers at the cafe will be upgraded

The primary cost of equipment will be versatile single-board computers. To save money, they will connect to the current hardware in the cyber cafe and will run Linux. A list of the current cyber cafe's inventory can be found on Google Drive.

All supplies and equipment to be purchased include:

  • 10 Arduino or Kano computer board starter kits as they are among the cheapest computers in the world (in terms of both immediate and long-term cost) and come with accessories. They will be purchased in the U.S. and shipped to Cameroon. $75-100 each. ($750-$1000 + $150 estimated shipping = $900-$1150)
  • Accessories to upgrade the current HP Compaq dc7100 desktop computers so that users will have the best experience with Peppermint OS ($400)
  • Indiegogo & PayPal fees ($350-$600)
  • Fulfillment of perks ($400)

Other materials that can be obtained free of cost:

  • Peppermint Linux open source software for the desktop OS as to avoid license conflicts
  • Offline educational content
  • Current electricity installations and network cabling in the building

If the fundraising goal is exceeded, all funds will go toward the purchase of extra computer boards.

Remember, every dollar counts - it's about your donation - not the amount given!

If the fundraising goals are not met, what funds are raised will be put toward the purchase of the physical space for the cyber learning center.

Not just any cyber cafe

We welcome individuals who want to collaborate to build the skills of the community, and to grow small, sustainable, socially conscious businesses. The learning center will be a special place where all are encouraged to use a computer.

The aim of the project is to create both a physical center and a virtual network that will accommodate Cameroonians who are hungry to learn new skills and become involved the global ICT world. Primary goals are to permit them to be competitive in the job market and to improve their community's quality of life.

The business will be a social space with excellent training and support. Stephan and other skilled professionals will serve as mentors; innovative sessions and workshops will be common. Furthermore, the learning center will be always changing and growing as to adapt with the community's needs.

Children intently gather around a computer to learn

How the center will scale

Once funded, the learning center will charge for computer and printer use in order to defray electricity, internet, and supply costs. The cost of using the center is to be determined, but will potentially vary based on need to give all an opportunity to learn ICT skills. Food, computer parts/repairs, and local art will potentially be available for sale as well to provide additional revenue.

At least two paid staff and unpaid volunteers will help monitor users and will help with instruction accordingly.

Stephan expects to have local support from at least one organization whose aim is to promote small business. Partnerships with schools, universities, and social programs will attract additional users. These affiliations will also help cement the center as a trusted community resource.
_______________________

Stephan is passionate about impact sourcing - bringing internet-based jobs to disadvantaged communities. Impact sourcing has the potential to fight poverty in developing countries. Visit ImpactHub for more information on this dynamic concept.

Tim, the host of this campaign, started the website oAfrica in 2009 to raise awareness of African internet progress. He and Stephan have known each other for three years and both share the same vision of helping underserved African communities fulfill their potential.

Lynn, a valuable contributor to this campaign, is an occupational therapist based in Toronto and in Bamenda. She is a former Chair of the Board of Bamenda Coordinating Centre for Studies in Disability and Rehabilitation. She shares Stephan's goal of making communication, participation, and technology more accessible and inclusive.

We welcome individuals that want to collaborate to build skills of the community. Please visit our page on oAfrica to learn more ways to give.

Thank you!
story_txt:
Hi - My name is Marc Stephan Nkouly from Bamenda, Cameroon (located in the North West Region of the country). I'm a tech evangelist with many years experience working at a local cyber cafe. More than anything, I'm passionate about open source computing and the doors it can open for my community in Bamenda.The cyber cafe is being sold and I have a great opportunity to ensure that the space is best utilized to empower the local community. With your help, I can purchase the facility and make it an open source cyber learning center to provide skills training to many people in the community, including many people who have few opportunities to get high quality training.Update: With days remaining for this campaign, the initial goal is likely out
 of reach but that doesn't mean we can't use additional support from 
your networks as we have a few exciting developments to mention.In fact, Stephan has strengthened his relationship with the current owner 
of the cyber café who is willing to sell the space for less than anticipated - 1.75 million 
CFA (roughly US $3,700). In other words, the owner has agreed to sell the business and 
building under an installment plan that is $2,500 less than initially thought.
The 1st 500 000 CFA (US $1,050) was paid on 18 Mar 2014 (last week) signifying the transfer of responsibility of the business. This is a great step forward!
The 2nd 750 000 CFA (US $1,600) will be paid by 18 June
2014 (3 months from now).
The 3rd 500 000 CFA (US $1,050) will be paid by 18 Sept
2014 (6 months from now) upon which will result the transfer of the property through deed of
sale.
We are not sure how the next couple of months will proceed, but all funds raised from here out will go toward the June 18th payment for the cyber café. An offline campaign is also in progress to raise awareness for the need to fund Marc Stephan's dream to empower the community of Bamenda.Introduction"The child destined to invent the next version of the internet could be without a computer right now. We need to change that." - Ken Starks, Reglue.org
Empowerment is about having the ability to use knowledge, to make decisions on your own behalf, and to improve the society. In today's world, computing skills are crucial. We are making Cameroon into an information society and a regional leader in ICT business and tech incubation. Training centers in the area currently act as "train and go" rather than "train and grow." Many people are reluctant to come in. Users may learn to surf the Internet or use social media but they do not stay to learn lifelong knowledge. Better access to information means developing abilities to solve problems facing society. Computer education builds self-esteem and can be a great outlet for creativity and teamwork.Youth using computers at the cafeBackground"What the whole world wants is a good job." - Jim Clifton, Gallup CEO
Our vision is that community empowerment can happen through the use low-cost computers and free software. Specifically, we are proposing an innovative, community-based and community-driven information and communication center that emphasizes the importance of using a wide range of technologies for critical thinking. It will make a significant contribution to building a more inclusive society. The center will cater to all groups, including people who are poor, disabled, or marginalized for other reasons. In short, it will address the diverse needs of the majority of the people in the Bamenda region.Here's why we need it:In developing countries, most workers earn a living through agriculture or domestic service. A living wage is hard to come by. Poor infrastructure makes it difficult to create new jobs. Fortunately, the Internet is changing the cycle of poverty as people are able to develop skills that allow them to create new forms of business that tie-in with the global economy.Mobile phones are common in the North West region of Cameroon but few young people have an environment whether they can learn useful computer skills. Schools lack an ICT curriculum and most cyber cafes do not provide training. Few Cameroonians know how to use a computer to find a job, launch their own business, or learn about the world. There are several groups of people who could benefit from a more socially oriented model of computer based learning and employment. People who are poor and vulnerable are particularly affected, but also have strengths and opportunities. In developing nations like Cameroon, youth (those under 30), women, people living with disabilities and chronic illnesses are often seeking employment but face discrimination and disproportionately high unemployment rates.Women are welcomed with open arms to use the cafeSome people have never had the opportunity to use a computer, and now don’t have the courage to enter an internet cafe. Many others, who do have the courage to come to a cybercafe, don't even have basic understandings of computers and the internet. Those who do come and do research on a topic (usually related to what they do offline) are expecting the internet, through a search engine, to give them the answer. Unfortunately, when they don't find the kind of answer they were hoping for, they feel reluctant to come next time.From these observations, we have seen the need to create a safe and inclusive space for people to admit they don’t know about computers so they can learn more.In an ideal educational system, these people would have acquired the skills they need to be comfortable with the internet and computers at school and at home as they grow up. Unfortunately, the education system in developing countries such as Cameroon’s is not adequate. There are many youth who went to professional training centers but who fail to translate their learning into jobs. This group could also be useful mentors and trainers to those who are just learning about ICT.In addition, there is a group of people who have learned extensive ICT skills on their own in informal environments but who cannot leverage their knowledge, because they don't have any certificate to demonstrate what they know. This lack of credential precludes them from obtaining better jobs. There is a need for a competency-based certificate program that would assist this group to move into jobs in the ICT and related sectors. This new community based/social business will address these needs and opportunities.What's neededOnce the physical space is purchased under an installment plan (1 750 000 CFA, or US $3,700), the need will be to fill it with the right tools to train the local community. Though the current HP desktop computers in the cyber cafe will be sold with the business, they are aging fast and are not energy-efficient by today's standards. The furniture will remain, as it is still suitable to a computer learning center.Current computers at the cafe will be upgradedThe primary cost of equipment will be versatile single-board computers. To save money, they will connect to the current hardware in the cyber cafe and will run Linux. A list of the current cyber cafe's inventory can be found on Google Drive.All supplies and equipment to be purchased include:
10 Arduino or Kano computer board starter kits as they are among the cheapest computers in the world (in terms of both immediate and long-term cost) and come with accessories. They will be purchased in the U.S. and shipped to Cameroon. $75-100 each. ($750-$1000 + $150 estimated shipping = $900-$1150)

Accessories to upgrade the current HP Compaq dc7100 desktop computers so that users will have the best experience with Peppermint OS ($400)

Indiegogo & PayPal fees ($350-$600)
Fulfillment of perks ($400)

Other materials that can be obtained free of cost:

Peppermint Linux open source software for the desktop OS as to avoid license conflicts
Offline educational content
Current electricity installations and network cabling in the building

If the fundraising goal is exceeded, all funds will go toward the purchase of extra computer boards.Remember, every dollar counts - it's about your donation - not the amount given!If the fundraising goals are not met, what funds are raised will be put toward the purchase of the physical space for the cyber learning center.Not just any cyber cafeWe welcome individuals who want to collaborate to build the skills of the community, and to grow small, sustainable, socially conscious businesses. The learning center will be a special place where all are encouraged to use a computer.The aim of the project is to create both a physical center and a virtual network that will accommodate Cameroonians who are hungry to learn new skills and become involved the global ICT world. Primary goals are to permit them to be competitive in the job market and to improve their community's quality of life.The business will be a social space with excellent training and support. Stephan and other skilled professionals will serve as mentors; innovative sessions and workshops will be common. Furthermore, the learning center will be always changing and growing as to adapt with the community's needs.Children intently gather around a computer to learnHow the center will scaleOnce funded, the learning center will charge for computer and printer use in order to defray electricity, internet, and supply costs. The cost of using the center is to be determined, but will potentially vary based on need to give all an opportunity to learn ICT skills. Food, computer parts/repairs, and local art will potentially be available for sale as well to provide additional revenue.At least two paid staff and unpaid volunteers will help monitor users and will help with instruction accordingly.Stephan expects to have local support from at least one organization whose aim is to promote small business. Partnerships with schools, universities, and social programs will attract additional users. These affiliations will also help cement the center as a trusted community resource._______________________Stephan is passionate about impact sourcing - bringing internet-based jobs to disadvantaged communities. Impact sourcing has the potential to fight poverty in developing countries. Visit ImpactHub for more information on this dynamic concept.Tim, the host of this campaign, started the website oAfrica in 2009 to raise awareness of African internet progress. He and Stephan have known each other for three years and both share the same vision of helping underserved African communities fulfill their potential.Lynn, a valuable contributor to this campaign, is an occupational therapist based in Toronto and in Bamenda. She is a former Chair of the Board of Bamenda Coordinating Centre for Studies in Disability and Rehabilitation. She shares Stephan's goal of making communication, participation, and technology more accessible and inclusive.We welcome individuals that want to collaborate to build skills of the community. Please visit our page on oAfrica to learn more ways to give.Thank you!

story:
Welcome to BotWorkshopTM

UPDATE: OUR BETA IS NOW OPEN. HEAD ON OVER TO http://botworkshop.com TO KICK THE TIRES!

One of the fastest ways to learn to code is to look at other folks' programs. Of course, it helps if the programs are focused on something you're interested in.

At BotWorkshop, we're creating a community of gamers and coders with an open source game platform that allows old hands to unleash their creative energy and novices to learn the basics of coding, computer science and math. Further, we're building an e-learning platform that connects educators and students.

Learning to code is a challenge.  We're turning that challenge into a fun way to learn.

A Little History

Back in the 70's, the game RobotWar introduced programming concepts via a robot battle game. It is a fun idea that has been used many times since, including various games that are direct descendents of RobotWar. BotWorkshop owes a debt to RobotWar although the basic design of the game is quite different.  

Dave (the principal architect of the BotWorkshop platform) learned to code by entering BASIC games into his Apple II+ and, later, coding lo-res versions of Pac-Man and Donkey Kong.  He loved computer games and the satisfaction he received from creating his own propelled him to a career as a software developer. 

Taking a step back, learning to code is difficult and can be especially challenging for kids. BotWorkshop focuses on games because, well, they're fun and are limited only by the imagination of their creators.

Community Always

At BotWorkshop, we’re building a community of gamers and coders who want to create and play fun games. We intend to keep access to the web site and games free.  Our goal is to grow into a place where someone can come to play games, create games either from scratch or by ‘cloning’ someone else’s work, and learn from others. Sharing and community are baked into BotWorkshop.

Of course, BotWorkshop is about gaming so we encourage friendly competition via leaderboards and achievements.

Have a cool idea for a casual game?  BotWorkshop's web-based development environment will give you a jump start.


Learn to Code by Playing a Game

The best way to learn a new computer language or technology is to look at what others have done. BotWorkshop is designed from the ground up for sharing and collaboration. Work your way through guides and challenges, ask questions in the forums and share your own ideas. All site resources, aside from tutoring, are available for free.

We recognize that not everyone, especially kids, can fully benefit from self-directed learning. We are creating an e-learning platform that enables students to take classes within the BotWorkshop environment.  Teachers will help students complete guides and challenges covering topics ranging from coding to computer science, math to artificial intelligence.

Looking for a fun way to introduce your child to the joys and challenges of coding?  BotWorkshop classes are a great way to keep kids interested and engaged as they solve problems and build their own bots.

We anticipate that our classes will cost $15/session with multi-session discounts.

Teach Others to Code

Are you an experienced coder?  Want to earn money by tutoring others and teaching online classes?  BotWorkshop’s e-learning platform is designed to connect students and teachers. Tutor students one-on-one or teach small classes.  Monitor students’ progress and give them feedback in class or via your own private class forum.

You can use teaching guides created by community members, or create your own guides.  Topics are only limited by your imagination.

The BotWorkshop platform provides a straightforward object model that can be used “out of the box” for a variety of challenges (for example, handling events, solving mazes, herding ducks, etc.).  If you need something more extensive (soccer anyone?), the open source platform is completely extensible.

Make a Difference

We think the BotWorkshop platform is pretty cool and are excited about the prospect of connecting students and teachers. However, we recognize that not every eager student can afford to pay for a class. To help remedy this, we plan on devoting a percentage of our revenue (we're aiming for 5%) to make tutoring and classes freely available to underserved kids.

We plan on incorporating BotWorkshop as a California Flexible Purpose Corporation. In a nutshell, a Flexible Purpose Corporation can state a "special purpose" in its charter that is different from making money for its shareholders.  Our purpose will be to provide educational resources to underserved kids.

Although not every kid is interested in learning to code, we want to help educate as many kids as possible, regardless of economic resources.

The BotWorkshop Team

Dave Klein has been coding since the late 70's.  He cut his teeth writing BASIC programs for the Apple II and was a professional software developer for over 14 years. Dave co-founded AbilityWare, a Web 1.0 personalization company. Although AbilityWare did not set the web world on fire, Dave is quite proud that he was able to make his investors whole at a time when many folks lost a bundle. More recently, Dave has worked as a financial strategist and won the 2013 Wagner Award for Advances in Active Investment Management. Additionally, he co-teaches a C++ course at UC Berkeley's Haas School of Business. Dave still codes every day, mainly for fun, and wants to share the joy and creativity of coding with folks looking to get started. 

Brian Villmoare also programmed his first games in Apple II BASIC, although Satellite War never did become the hit he had hoped. It was through programming that he found a love of math and statistics that stood him in good stead through graduate school.  Today he is a research paleontologist and university educator and continues to program, most often to model biological systems and quantitative genetics. His experiences teaching programming and statistics, and his desire to get younger students to learn to program, has been one of the influences that led to the creation of BotWorkshop.

In part, BotWorkshop is the answer to the question of how Dave & Brian would introduce the world of programming to their kids: Jack, Sophia, Margo & Ava.

Where We are Now

We've completed the web-based development environment and the first cut of our open source game engine.  We should unleash the platform on beta testers some time in January 2014.  UPDATE: Our beta is now open at http://botworkshop.com, head on over to kick the tires! We still need to finish up the e-learning platform to allow students and teachers to collaborate on coding sessions. We also need to beef up our server infrastructure and web site to ensure everything scales well.

If we are funded, we plan on launching in early May (hopefully earlier).

Where the Money Goes

BotWorkshop started as a labor of love. We were looking for a compelling way to teach our kids about coding and math. As we continued to work on the idea, we realized that other folks would derive value from it is well.  In order to reach full potential, we need to give the project the professional attention it deserves.

We're raising money to fund:

  • Continued development of the BotWorkshop game platform
  • Enhancements to the BotWorkshop web site
  • Beefed up cloud infrastructure 
  • Legal & accounting fees to ensure we launch properly

Stretch goals include professionally-produced how-to videos, support for more computer languages and creation of a BotWorkshop mobile app.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute to the campaign, you can still help us out if you believe in our mission.

1. Pass along a link to the campaign to friends.  Send them to: http://igg.me/at/botworkshop or feel free to send them straight to http://botworkshop.com.

2. Help us as a beta tester. Head over to http://botworkshop.com and fill out the form indicating your interest in testing the platform.

3. Sign up as a tutor.  Want to use the BotWorkshop platform to help others and earn money?  Head over to http://botworkshop.com and fill out the form indicating you want to tutor.

Finally, BotWorkshop is built on the work of others.  Please check out our attributions page.

story:
Help us help kids

Hi...my name is Lorraine Murray and I'm the founder of the Teach Children Meditation Campaign and author of 'Calm Kids - help children relax with mindful activities'.  

For a long time we've been teaching and promoting the idea of teaching kids meditation and mindfulness because we know it works.  

Every day we receive an email (like the one below) or read a Facebook post or tweet that confirms to us that if people teach their kids meditation then it makes a very positive difference to their lives.

  • "I have really enjoyed teaching the meditation both here at the Hospice and in one of our local schools. I am now working with my second group of nine year olds. I had a group of fifteen nine year olds in the summer, all of whom were identified because of attention/behaviour issues. A little daunting as first experience, but I quickly learned that it was my assumptions that were generating the sense of being a bit daunted. When I actually started with the kids it was great and they were very responsive indeed. The second group is one that does not have the same associated issues, and this is going well. The school were very impressed with the response of the first group, hence the request to develop things further." D McCormick, St Andrew's Hospice

You see,  we think that we have a lot of stressed kids out there and we need to give them the simple tools to help them feel peaceful in this demanding world.  

Kids are overstimulated by their environment (food, noise, pollution) whilst become less and less attached to the world through technology of games, phones, computers... 

It's just about having some balance - living in the world we have created but still able to find a moment of peace to help us and our kids deal with the big stuff life throws at us.  

Kids need some peace more than ever.

We've been doing this for about 10 years but it is time to step it up a gear and here's where we need your help.


What We Need 

We need funding to help us launch our 2nd book - Connected Kids. 

  1. It's going to show how we can teach this to kids experiencing Autism, ADHD or who have special needs.  (We've worked with individual families worldwide who are featured in the book, telling their story and showing other parents and educators what they can do).

We need funding for...

The editing - this makes an okay book turn into a great book.  We learnt this from the first book experience.   Cost - $1654

The book cover design - we need the next book cover to make an impact as it makes a huge difference to book sales.  We've had so many positive comments on the first book cover... we know this makes a huge difference.

 (Featured:  the first book - Calm Kids)

The more we sell the more money we can use to fund the campaign and scholarships. Cost - $827

E-book format - we'll eventually have a printed version but we starting off with the e-book version so this means we have to have some very techie guys do the coding/layout for us. Cost - $827

Book Trailer - we are using the book to raise the profile of our campaign and help spread the word. Production costs- $1654

Promotion - there's no point having this great resource if people don't know about it and use it.  We have to tell people and we have our publicity channels set to do this -  Cost - $2481.

The first 150 - having the first 150 books printed to give us a thank you gift to visionaries...like you!   Cost - $1369


Our Thank You's

Anything you can give is truly appreciated. 

  • Each donation level has its own unique thanks and gifts including signed copies of the new book and exclusive opportunities to 'meet' me the founder, join us on a training session, sneak (exclusive) previews of the book trailer and cover designs and an exclusive online book reading of some chapters of the book .  Every single donation large or small will make a difference - all receive our heartfelt gratitude.


The Impact


Here are some of the benefits kids experience when they learn meditation.

  • improved self esteem - feeling good about themselves
  • focus and concentration skills - great for study
  • making better decisions in life - what we call 'emotional intelligence'
  • kids with ADHD (and others) - they learn how to feel calmer and sleep better
  • kids with autism - they learn how to cope better with the world around them

Remember... the benefits affect all the adults too (teachers, parents...) 

Plus - this isn't just for kids.  This is for teens and any young person who wants to learn a life skill that helps them cope.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, it doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please get the word out about our campaign. Teach Children Meditation Campaign
  • Retweet fundraising and support posts on twitter using @meditation4kids
  • Check out our twitter page: Twitter Campaign
  • Learn more about teaching kids meditation and mindfulness on Teach Children Meditation

Thanks for taking the time to check out and support the work we've been doing. 

_/\_ Namaste

Lorraine Murray and the Connected Kids Team


In case you are from outside the US...

$15 = £9 or 11 euros

$25 = £15 or 18 euros

$75 = £45 or 55 euros

$125 = £75 or 90 euros

$250 = £150 or 180 euros

$500 = £300 or 365 euros

(approximate exchange rates)

response of the first group, hence the request to develop things further." D McCormick, St Andrew's Hospice
You see,  we think that we have a lot of stressed kids out there and we need to give them the simple tools to help them feel peaceful in this demanding world.  Kids are overstimulated by their environment (food, noise, pollution) whilst become less and less attached to the world through technology of games, phones, computers... It's just about having some balance - living in the world we have created but still able to find a moment of peace to help us and our kids deal with the big stuff life throws at us.  Kids need some peace more than ever.We've been doing this for about 10 years but it is time to step it up a gear and here's where we need your help.What We Need We need funding to help us launch our 2nd book - Connected Kids. It's going to show how we can teach this to kids experiencing Autism, ADHD or who have special needs.  (We've worked with individual families worldwide who are featured in the book, telling their story and showing other parents and educators what they can do).We need funding for...
The editing - this makes an okay book turn into a great book.  We learnt this from the first book experience.   Cost - $1654The book cover design - we need the next book cover to make an impact as it makes a huge difference to book sales.  We've had so many positive comments on the first book cover... we know this makes a huge difference. (Featured:  the first book - Calm Kids)The more we sell the more money we can use to fund the campaign and scholarships. Cost - $827E-book format - we'll eventually have a printed version but we starting off with the e-book version so this means we have to have some very techie guys do the coding/layout for us. Cost - $827Book Trailer - we are using the book to raise the profile of our campaign and help spread the word. Production costs- $1654Promotion - there's no point having this great resource if people don't know about it and use it.  We have to tell people and we have our publicity channels set to do this -  Cost - $2481.The first 150 - having the first 150 books printed to give us a thank you gift to visionaries...like you!   Cost - $1369Our Thank You'sAnything you can give is truly appreciated. Each donation level has its own unique thanks and gifts including signed copies of the new book and exclusive opportunities to 'meet' me the founder, join us on a training session, sneak (exclusive) previews of the book trailer and cover designs and an exclusive online book reading of some chapters of the book .  Every single donation large or small will make a difference - all receive our heartfelt gratitude.The ImpactHere are some of the benefits kids experience when they learn meditation.

improved self esteem - feeling good about themselves


focus and concentration skills - great for study


making better decisions in life - what we call 'emotional intelligence'


kids with ADHD (and others) - they learn how to feel calmer and sleep better


kids with autism - they learn how to cope better with the world around them

Remember... the benefits affect all the adults too (teachers, parents...) Plus - this isn't just for kids.  This is for teens and any young person who wants to learn a life skill that helps them cope.  Other Ways You Can HelpEven if you can’t contribute, it doesn’t mean you can’t help:
Please get the word out about our campaign. Teach Children Meditation Campaign

Retweet fundraising and support posts on twitter using @meditation4kids
Check out our twitter page: Twitter Campaign

Learn more about teaching kids meditation and mindfulness on Teach Children Meditation

Thanks for taking the time to check out and support the work we've been doing. _/\_ Namaste
Lorraine Murray and the Connected Kids Team
In case you are from outside the US...$15 = £9 or 11 euros$25 = £15 or 18 euros$75 = £45 or 55 euros$125 = £75 or 90 euros$250 = £150 or 180 euros$500 = £300 or 365 euros(approximate exchange rates)

story:
******Fundraiser has ENDED but! you can still DONATE through PAYPAL at MadMadLove33@yahoo.com or on homepage of website: www.madmadlove.com

Salutations World Savers, Humanitarians and Dreamers! Hello Free Spirits, Non Conformists, Pioneers, Visionaries, Dubious Strangers and Fellow Wayseers! Welcome Professionals, Students, Mothers, Fathers, Leaders and Preachers!

I Don't Know You, But I Love You!

It is true, I mean it, it is tattooed on my arm & I am determined for every human to hear it at least once. Would you like that as well? If so:

I am super excited to present to You the Opportunity to Spread the Love to those that need it most:

<3 Orphans <3

Please allow me to introduce myself by my nick name, Charlizzle Blizzle.

There is much I could say about myself, but I would rather you watch The Video:

Because what is most important is not who I am but how I make you feel: my energy, how my smile makes you feel, if there is sincerity in my voice, if I get you EXCITED.

I am here to give you confidence in donating to a simple and complex, abstract idea: I believe passing out a sticker that says, "I Don't Know You, But I Love You" is a method for Ending Racism.

If racism was not largely present in society’s judgments & governments’ decision making, surely The People would be able to quickly unite together as One. This sticker is a method for Uniting as One in an Extremely Exhilarating and Electrifying way!

So Start S.W.W.Sing Everyday People!

S.W.W.S = Saving the World With Stickers!

I can prove how this is so but I like Fun A LOT and what is more Fun at this moment is to now talk about how the sticker makes people feel. 

Even if you do not believe or understand how the sticker Ends Racism, it most certainly Makes People Very Happy. It Changes Lives. That is what I care most about:

Making Others Feel As Good As I Do on a Daily Basis.

Reactions to Receiving the Sticker:
*Speechlessness *Huge Smile *Involuntary Squeal *Jumping *High-Fiving *Hugging *Cheering *Demand for More Stickers *Tears of Joy * Looks of Love

If this sounds like your type of activity Buy Some Stickers!

Experience these reactions from your gifting or tagging AND!
Feel the Love & Appreciation from across the world as young children and teenagers receive this message, perhaps some for the first time. Imagine what that reaction is like, imagine how it will feel.

3... 2... 1... BLASTOFF!!!

**Donate To or Share this Campaign Valentine's Day Weekend and receive the coolest 3D Holographic Positive Vibes Valentine Plus 1 for a Loved One!

Just telling someone the name of this campaign is giving them a gift: You are telling them The Truth: There are people in the world that love their neighbor unconditionally.

(To respect your time, information is ranked from most important-to-know down to the longer detailed explanations. Click on links for awesome additional info. Email us address or FB profile to connect & receive gifts!)

**This is a campaign to fundraise money to design, print & ship stickers that say in a variety of languages: I Don't Know You, But I Love You to orphans in orphanages. A variety of age appropriate stickers are to be made.

**This campaign supports the IDKYBILY, Inc nonprofit to reach tax exempt status as well as operational costs.

**The perks are Creations & Gifts of Volunteers of the nonprofit. Your donation supports their time, money & effort.

*Please notice perk packages have Extra Gifts so YOU can gift, share & have as much fun as We have passing out free items to enhance Good Times.

*All perk packages have potential to be sent with extra gifts. IDKYBILY volunteers quickly become inspired by other's acts of volunteerism and there are new offerings every day! Email us to Share & Donate YOUR Creations! We would love to add them to this campaign!

*Indiegogo does not recognize cents. All the donation amounts have special meanings, they are in the title, but you will not be able to donate an amount that has cents in it, for example: $33.33 will be changed to $33.00 even donation.

**If there is no comment box when donating, please message this email for T-shirt size & color. If you have a custom perk request don't be shy! Write and ask us. We want to meet all of your S.W.W.S needs:     MadMadLove33@yahoo.com

**Make sure to provide proper mailing addresses (don't forget your apt. #) Surprise your friends and family & have the perks sent directly to them. 

**This website is very exciting, please take a look at the hundreds of choices we have to send the stickers.

http://www.orphanage.org/  

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Budget

***2,000 stickers from StickerJunkie.com English IDKYBILY stickers                      $480

***1,000 stickers from StickerJunkie.com Alternate Language stickers:                   $270

***501(c)3 Incorporation and Tax Exempt Status for Nonprofit                           $400

***LegalZoom service fee to file application (working 3 jobs I am unable to do this myself with precision, I need the assistance if you would like to charge less or volunteer please email us!)                                                                                                         $595

***Postage, shipping & handling (not able to precisely calculate)                         $TBD

Extra Funds If Overfunded

**Payment to Director & Editor of Indiegogo video                                                      $250

**Graphic Designer for language stickers                                                                  $TDB

**Graphic Designer for MML symbols & logos                                                          $TDB

**Long Term funding for sticker design, printing & shipping                 $270 per 1,000 stix

**Vendor booths at music, art, science & yoga festivals               $200 to $800 per booth

**Investment money for MadMadLove Fest, an event 3 years in the planning, ready to book location, amenities, musicians and performers!                                              $TDB

**Investments to MMLovers’ small businesses, good, services, & talents              $TDB ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

                            MadMadLove & IDKYBILY Mission Statement                               Ending Racism By Inspiring & Sustaining a Nutured Non Racist & Non Bigoted Community. We Nuture Through Inclusivity, Trust & Uncondtional Love. Our Intentions & Actions are Based on the Principles of Peace, Love, Unity & Respect. We Strive for these Principles to be Ever Present in our Communication, Decision Making & Relationships. PARTY ON.

**IDKYBILY started in January of 2011 on Facebook. 300 strangers communicated, organized & planned daily for 4 months online, meeting for the first time at Coachella Music Festival; 175 people met at one spot, 32 cars drove in together with police escort. 

**As a network we evolved into a community of like minded music lovers. Strangers turned friends turned best friends turned lovers turned engaged turned married turned business partners turned roommates turned world travelers with bonds formed from inclusivity, trust & unconditional love.

**January 2012 IDKYBILY is incorporated as nonprofit in California.

**July 2013 CB delivers a speech detailing how to Unite the People in Peace, Love Unity & Respect at Lightning in a Bottle 2013 Music & Arts Festival

*MML = MadMadLove one of our group names; the name of our bond of loyalty.

*MMLovers = MadMadLovers; someone who spreads unconditional love

*IDKYBILY = I Don't Know You, But I Love You; name of non profit; our group's mantra to be racist and bigotry free.                                                                                               ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~I Don't Know You, But I Love You our group’s mantra. We use the mantra as a method by which we exemplify our commitment to be racist free. To Love Everyone despite not knowing them is the only guaranteed pathway to keep oneself discriminatory free, hatred free and full of positivity which always makes everything we do in life Better and Safer.

*Why End Racism?
  Racism is linked to illiteracy, poverty, hate crimes, epidemic diseases, environmental theft & destruction, drug use, incarceration profiteering, DEATH & MORE.

Why should Humanitarians split up their collective Energies into tunnel-visioned respective realms of aide when just ONE problem is causing them all?


*How To End Racism                                                                                                         To Love Everyone despite not knowing them is the only guaranteed pathway to keep oneself discriminatory free, hatred free and full of positivity which always makes everything we do in life Better and Safer.


*Who We Are                                                                                                                   Thus far, We are an elevated group of Thinkers, Military Soldiers, Families, Teenagers, Artists, Musicians, Accountants, Innovators, Performers, Engineers, Lawyers & Philosophers looking to find our Kindred Spirits & live amazing lives together helping each other & ultimately, the Entire World =) 


Join Us & Help This list GROW!

*What We Need
We Don’t Need Followers, We Need Believers ♥                                                                 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Why do happy people want to make others happy? Let us be honest: yes sometimes it is a selfish desire to want to express one's good fortune and stability. Sometimes it is an unintentional self-centeredness. Last but not least, it most certainly is a symptom of happiness to express happiness!

I am here to be Real with Everyone taking the time to read this: *I* desire to make other's happy because: It Makes My Life Easier.

We all want our Lives to be Easier and we all Deserve It.

I got Lucky: I am a naturally very happy person. The video shows this. (Im a little silly too ;))

I had a beautiful childhood and teenage adolescence. I made straight As and knew I was bound for college and long term success at an "important" career.

Then at 17 I developed chronic migraines and that is when I began my Struggle in America.

Once a debilitating medical condition enters one's life, there is not much great parents can do, good grades do not make the pain go away, jobs start avoiding your employment and nothing you plan ever goes according to plan.

Once one experiences physical pain every day.....one starts to realize what is most important in life:

After 13 years of struggle, pain, injustice and personal growth I know what is most important to me & I believe I know what is most important to most people:

Love. Receiving Love. Giving Love.

The Most Important, Rewarding and Fulfilling Activity in my life and for the last 3 years is spreading a message of Unconditional Love. It makes me Feel Better about My Struggle. It helps me to Accept and Be Strong in the face of Other's Struggle, of the Struggles of the Entire Planet.

Have you ever wanted to feel less overwhlemed by the negativity of worldly affairs? Do you ever wish you had more control over your fear and anxiety?

I have taken control of my anxiety, my past, my trauma, my disappointments and expectations by passing out this sticker. When I give it a stranger and their face lights up, they smile, they squeal, they jump up and down, they hug me, they high five me, they start to share their strongest emotions, their secrets their fears and anxiety

I Feel Great. I feel fulfilled. Best of all: I feel ready for Life's Challenges.

I want to relate to each and every person. I apologize if you cannot relate to the people in our video. I want to ask each of you, FOR FUN, to ignore any judgements and instead keep reading, keep researching our philosophies and pictures and Give it a Try!

Buy some stickers and see for yourself what happens if you tag them or pass them out. 

Don't rely on just my words: take action and prove to yourself if passing out this message makes you feel good. =)
