story:
ConCiencia Summer Nature Camp

ConCiencia’s 5-week travelling summer nature camp is a window to the wonders of nature for dozens of coastal Peruvian children each year. We pack up our telescope, fish nets, goggles, bathing suits, and our team moves to a small fishing coastal village. Each week we welcome a rotating cast  of outstanding professionals from different fields to create multidisciplinary lesson plans. In ConCiencia, wonder at nature turns complex scientific concepts into practical playful experience.

"ConCiencia"  means both "awareness" and "with science". Four years ago, a group of young, passionate nature-lovers from diverse disciplines founded this Peruvian non-profit as an environmental education summer camp for a small fishing community in northern Peru. Today we are a nature-based education platform working with 400 students and over 30 teachers per year, co-creating innovative experiences, designing custom outdoor lessons and promoting nature-based student-driven education.

We have always crowdsourced this program, through merchandising and fundraisers. Now we want to open the opportunity for a global reach to support our mission. Through your contribution you will directly impact a child in a life-changing way. 


What We Need & What You Get

Staff Transportation (5 team members + 10 guest teachers)        $ 2500

Housing and Food for 6 weeks  (10 people)                                           $ 3500

Teacher Stipend  and Preparation Costs                                                $ 3500

Materials  (paint, goggles, microscopes, t-shirts, printing, dvds)   $ 700

Family Fun Day (Community outreach event)                                       $ 300

Snacks and beverages                                                                                    $ 500

Small grant for local youth nature club                                                    $ 500

Administrative and operational costs                                                       $  500

Field trips (bus rental + incidentals)                                                          $ 200

Perks and shipping                                                                                           $  700

Fundraising  Fee (12-14%)                                                                     $     1,800 - 2,100

    The Impact

    This is our 5th year bringing a nature and fun-filled summer to 40 children between ages 5 to 12, giving them a nudge to feel the wonder of nature and become ocean stewards. Access to a healthy environment is every child's right (IUCN, 2012). Children who are culturally denied time in nature miss out on important aspects of healthy development and subdue their stewardship possibilities. Time in nature impacts how we view and respect life and our purpose on Earth. 80-90% of conservation professionals attribute their choice to childhood experiences in nature (Cobb (1959), Guiney and Oberhauses (2009),Chawla (1999). 
    ConCiencia brings together professionals of all fields to teach through nature. Using nature as a learning technology, children connect to the natural world around them and each other. We focus on underserved communities, where dependence on natural resources is highest but the education of the processes that support them is lowest. 
    Our summer camp is a chance for us to host exceptional professionals and co-create place-based lesson plans to distribute to the schools and communities. We are an open-source organisation. One of our goals is to spark educators' creativity to teach lessons through nature.
    Shifting our focus towards nature-based learning projects will address important issues that threaten our population's health. Peru was rated last year by PISA as the lowest ranking country in education.
    Do we make a difference? 
    -In 2013, we discovered our 90% of 2nd year students increased understanding of almost 75% of the ecological concepts we explored. 
    -1 in 2 students increased the amount of time they spent in Nature. 
    -1 in 3 families incorporated nature in the leisure time
    -1 in 5 children picked up trash on family outings to the beach
    -80% of parents observed a positive change in their child's attitude towards the environment. 

    Risks & Challenges

    ConCiencia has a proven track record working with underserved coastal communities. While it is delicate to enter into a rural community, we have had good reception by having a strong philosophy of humility and respect. We meet parents, many times at their home, to discuss our program, their expectations, safety and our collective goals. Likewise, we integrate respectfully with teachers and schools. 

    ConCiencia Summer Nature Camp is a travelling program, working for two years in each location. Permanent change is important to us. During the second year we invite outstanding students from the 1st year to be team leaders. Our goal is to empower them to form nature clubs the following year through a small grant program. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Help us by sharing this campaign with your friends and family. 
    • Check out our website to learn more about us. 
    • Enjoy and share Nature!

    ¡Muchas Gracias de todo el equipo de ConCiencia!
